infotexts.pressanykey: Press any key to... kill em' all!
infotexts.loadingscreentip: There are many different types of planets and stations to explore.
Once an Arachnid colony reaches roughly 300 generations, they begin to get smarter. Why this occurs is currently unknown.
“We must meet the threat with our valor, our blood, indeed—with our very lives—to ensure that human civilization, not insect, dominates this galaxy... now and always!” Sky Marshal Dienes
Klendathu will fall before the might of the Federation.
Federal scientists are always looking for new ways to kill bugs.
Everyone's doing their part! Are you?
[zzzzzh] -reak Net to t-ke you li-- to Fleet Batt---tation Ticonderogaaaaa- [zzzck]
[zzzzzh] -verywhere! K--- --ghting..! Reinforcements will beeee- [zzzck]
[zzzzzh] -oo many o- -hem! Why didn't intel kn-w aboooo- [zzzck]
[zzzzzh] -em al-! For Buen-- Airessss- [zzzck]
[ FEDNET BROADCAST - Failure on Klendathu. Casualties ranging in the hundreds of thousands. Fleet officials admit they “underestimated” the Arachnids' defensive capability. ]
[ FEDNET BROADCAST - We now break Net to take you live to the Klendathu assault. ]

[ FEDNET BROADCAST - Sky Marshal Dienes accepts responsibility for Klendathu and resigns. His successor, Sky Marshal Tahat Meru, outlines her new strategy. “To fight the Bug, we must understand the Bug. We can ill-afford another Klendathu.” Sky Marshal Tahat Meru ]
[ WARNING - ARACHNID ATTACK. EVACUATE. ]
[ ALERT - BUG METEOR INBOUND ENTER SHELTERS AND AWAIT RESCUE - ALERT ]
[ ALERT - SKINNY INVASION SEEK SHELTER - ALERT ]
An excerpt from an intercepted Skinny broadcast: { The Federation cares not for you... }
An excerpt from an intercepted Skinny broadcast: { COME. JOIN. SERVE. }
[ INCOHERENT SCREECHING ]
[ ARACHNID SCREECHING ]
infotexts.randomnews1: BUG INFESTATION WORSENS — MILITARY DRAFT MEASURES POSSIBLE
infotexts.randomnews2: FEDERAL NETWORK DECLARES VICTORY ON PLANET P-13 — MILLIONS OF TROOPERS PERISHED HEROICALLY
infotexts.randomnews3: UNAUTHORIZED BREEDING IN COLONY SECTOR 9 — FAMILY UNIT DETAINED FOR RE-EDUCATION
infotexts.randomnews4: JOIN THE MOBILE INFANTRY — ENLISTMENT REACHES HISTORIC LOW, HIGH COMMAND CONCERNED
infotexts.randomnews5: ALIEN SYMPATHIZERS PUBLICLY EXECUTED — LOYALTY TO THE FEDERATION IS MANDATORY
infotexts.randomnews6: VICTORY ON MULTIPLE PLANETS — ENEMY HIVES EXTERMINATED
infotexts.randomnews7: YOUTH FEDERATION CORPS INTRODUCES COMBAT TRAINING FOR CHILDREN AGES 6 AND UP
infotexts.randomnews8: DISORDER IS TREASON — MARTIAL LAW DECLARED ON OUTLYING COLONIES
infotexts.randomnews9: CITIZENS PRAISE EXECUTION OF TRAITOROUS SENATOR — “HE SPOKE OF PEACE WITH BUGS”
infotexts.randomnews10: ARACHNID INFORMATION QUARANTINE IN EFFECT — UNAUTHORIZED MEDIA CONSUMPTION PUNISHABLE BY DEATH
infotexts.randomnews11: “I WANT TO KILL BUGS!” — YOUTH CHANT IN NATIONAL UNITY DAY CELEBRATIONS
infotexts.randomnews12: COLONY 42 “FAILED TO DEFEND ITSELF” — SURVIVORS TO FACE CAPITAL PUNISHMENT
infotexts.randomnews13: COUNCIL DEBATES PLANETARY GLASSING PROTOCOL FOR INFECTED WORLDS
infotexts.randomnews14: DESERTER EXECUTIONS TO BE BROADCAST ON ALL NET, ALL CHANNELS — “THEY FAILED YOU”
infotexts.randomnews15: ENEMY BUGS MUTATING FASTER — SCIENTISTS CALL FOR TOTAL WAR, NO LIMITS
infotexts.randomnews16: BATTLEFIELD PROMOTIONS REACH ALL-TIME HIGH — A SOLDIER DIES, A HERO IS BORN
infotexts.randomnews17: THOUGHT-CONTROL DEPARTMENT EXPOSES NEW SEDITIOUS PHILOSOPHY: “PEACE IN OUR TIME”
infotexts.randomnews18: GENETIC SCREENING REQUIREMENTS EXPANDED — ONLY THE FIT SHALL BREED
infotexts.randomnews19: FEDERAL NETWORK APPROVES MASS RELOCATION OF TRAITOROUS CIVILIANS TO “CONTAINMENT ZONES”
infotexts.randomnews20: VOLUNTEER OR VANISH — SERVICE NOW ONLY PATH TO HOUSING AND MEDICAL CARE
infotexts.randomnews21: BUGS BREACHED SECTOR WALLS — ENTIRE CITY INCINERATED TO PRESERVE ORDER
infotexts.randomnews22: SCHOOLS MANDATED TO BROADCAST DAILY VICTORY REELS — EDUCATION THROUGH PATRIOTISM
infotexts.randomnews23: LOYALTY TESTS BEGIN NEXT WEEK — NONCOMPLIANCE EQUALS DEFECTION
infotexts.randomnews24: FEDERAL DATA DIVISION IDENTIFIES 2,134 TRAITORS IN LAST 24 HOURS — NEIGHBORS ENCOURAGED TO REPORT SUSPICION
infotexts.randomnews25: “BUG LIVES MATTER” GRAFFITI FOUND — ENTIRE DISTRICT UNDER ARMED LOCKDOWN
infotexts.randomnews26: NEW HOLO-AD: “EVERY TIME YOU HESITATE, A PLANET DIES” — ENLISTMENT TRIPLES OVERNIGHT
infotexts.randomnews27: SKINNY PRISONERS FOUND TO ENJOY TORTURE — INTERROGATORS PRAISED FOR CULTURAL SENSITIVITY
infotexts.randomnews28: SKINNY CIVILIAN ESCAPES EXECUTION AFTER CLAIMING TO BE “JUST TALL AND SHY” — INVESTIGATION ONGOING
infotexts.randomnews29: SKINNY AMBASSADOR “BLINKED WEIRD” DURING PEACE TALKS — ENTIRE DELEGATION EXECUTED FOR INSOLENCE
infotexts.randomnews30: FEDERAL NETWORK DEBUTS NEW REALITY SHOW: “ARE YOU BUG ENOUGH TO DIE FOR EARTH?”
infotexts.randomnews31: PUBLIC FLAGELLATIONS RETURN TO THE CAPITAL — “PENANCE IS PATRIOTIC” CAMPAIGN LAUNCHES
infotexts.randomnews32: EXCESS EMOTION NOW CLASSIFIED AS SUSPICIOUS BEHAVIOR. SMILE WITHIN REGULATION
infotexts.pausemenuquitverification: Are you sure you want to return to the main menu? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.pausemenuretryverification: Are you sure you want to stop the mission and load the previous save file? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.pausemenuquitverificationeditor: Are you sure you want to return to the main menu? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.pausemenusaveandquitverification: If you quit now, you will lose the progress you've made during the round, and you'll have to start the mission from the beginning when continuing the campaign. Are you sure you want to quit?
infotexts.pausemenusaveandreturntoserverlobbyverif: Are you sure you want to save the game and return to the server lobby?
infotexts.pausemenusaveandreturntomainmenuverifica: Are you sure you want to save the game and return to the main menu?
infotexts.serverporttooltip: The port used to communicate with clients. If clients fail to connect to your server, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding or forward the port manually.
infotexts.serverqueryporttooltip: The port used to communicate with Steam's server browser and respond to info pings from clients. If clients don't see your server in the server list or if authenticating their Steam ID fails, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding or forward the port manually.
infotexts.publicservertooltip: Public servers are shown in the list of available servers in the "Server Browser."
infotexts.attemptupnptooltip: UPnP can be used for forwarding ports on your router to allow players to join the server. However, UPnP isn't supported by all routers, so you may need to setup port forwards manually if players are unable to join the server (see the readme for instructions).
infotexts.versionmismatchwarning: The version of the game executable (v[gameversion]) does not match the content (v[contentversion]). This may happen if you're using a mod that overrides the game executable, and the mod has not been updated to match the vanilla game content. Using a mismatching executable may result in various issues, including crashes and save file corruption.
infotexts.versionmismatch.verifylaunch: Do you still want to launch [exename]?
infotexts.gamemodedescription.singleplayercampaign: Embark on a journey through the reaches of space, while completely alone...
infotexts.gamemodedescription.sandbox: A game mode with no specific objectives.
infotexts.gamemodedescription.mission: The crew must work together to complete a single mission, such as retrieving an object or killing a creature that's terrorizing nearby outposts.
infotexts.gamemodedescription.multiplayercampaign: Embark on a journey through the reaches of space, but with friends!
infotexts.nosubscribedmods: You haven't subscribed to any mods on the Steam Workshop. Select the "Popular Mods" tab to find some!
infotexts.workshopitemcreatehelptext: You can use this tab to publish new items in the Steam Workshop. You can select a spaceship or a content package to publish from the "Your items" menu at the left.
infotexts.workshopitemcorepackagetooltip: Core packages are special content packages that contain all the core files (executables, configuration files) the game won't run without. There must always be one (and only one) core package selected. Only select this if you wish to create a mod that replaces all the Vanilla files. Mods that only add things to the Vanilla game (or another core package) should not be marked as core packages.
infotexts.workshopitemchangenotetooltip: You're publishing an update for an existing Workshop item. You can use the change note to explain what's new in the update.
infotexts.workshopitemdeletetooltip: Deletes the item from Steam Workshop.
infotexts.workshopitemdeleteverification: Are you sure you want to delete the item "[itemname]" from the Steam Workshop?
infotexts.workshopitempublishtooltip: Uploads the files to the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.workshopitemfileincluded: File will be included in the Workshop item.
infotexts.workshopitemfilenotincluded: File is not present in the Workshop item folder and will not be included in the Workshop item. This may be desirable if you want the mod to use Vanilla files that the players already have—otherwise you should copy the file to the Workshop item folder.
infotexts.workshopitemillegalpath: Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder. Please create a separate subfolder for the files.
infotexts.workshopitemrefreshfilelisttooltip: Reload the configuration file of the Workshop item (filelist.xml inside the item's folder) and add all new files in it to the file list.
infotexts.workshopitempublished: [itemname] is now available in the Steam Workshop!
infotexts.workshopitempublishfailed: Publishing "[itemname]" in the Steam Workshop failed.
infotexts.workshopitempreviewimagedialogtitle: Select the preview image for the Steam Workshop item.
infotexts.workshopitempreviewimagetoolarge: The file size of the preview image has to be less than 1 MB.
infotexts.workshoperrorinstallrequiredtoedit: Cannot edit the Workshop item "[itemname]" because it has not been installed.
infotexts.workshoperrorinstallrequiredtoenable: Cannot enable the Workshop item "[itemname]" because it has not been installed.
infotexts.workshoperroroverwriteonenable: Cannot enable Workshop item "[itemname]". The file "[filename]" would be overwritten by the item.
infotexts.workshoperrorillegalpathonenable: Could not install the file "[filename]". Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder.
infotexts.workshopitemincompatibletooltip: This Workshop item is not compatible with your version of Barotrauma.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.limitexceeded: Publishing the Workshop item failed (limit exceeded). Make sure you have enabled Steam Cloud and haven't exceeded your Steam Cloud quota. If you are using Steam Cloud sync, having a large number of save files can cause you to run out of space on the cloud. You may want to check [savepath] to make sure you're not storing an excessive number of save files.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.limiteduseraccount: Publishing the Workshop item failed. Limited user accounts are not allowed to publish items in the Steam Workshop. You need to spend at least $5 in the Steam store to become a non-limited user.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.banned: Publishing the Workshop item failed because your account has been banned.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.insufficientprivile: Publishing the Workshop item failed (insufficient privileges). This can happen due to a hub ban, account lock or a community ban. You may need to contact Steam Support.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.serviceunavailable: Publishing the Workshop item failed (service unavailable). The workshop servers may be having issues. Please try again in a moment.
infotexts.unstableworkshopitempublishwarning: Releasing workshop items with Barotrauma Unstable is not recommended. Features in Unstable are not guaranteed to make it to the public version in the exact same form, and mods developed for Unstable may not work as-is in the public version. Players who are using the normal version of Barotrauma will also not be able to install the item. Are you sure you want to publish the item?
infotexts.workshopitemvisibilitytooltip: Restricts who can see and subscribe to your Workshop item.
infotexts.workshoperrorsamepathinstalled: Could not install "[itemname]" because there is already a mod installed at "[itempath]."
infotexts.confirmfiledeletion: Are you sure you want to permanently delete "[file]"?
infotexts.modsinstallednotif: Mods installed; open settings to enable
infotexts.workshopitemdownloadprompt: The following Workshop items are required to play on this server: [items] Would you like to subscribe to them?
infotexts.LocalCopyRequired: You do not have a local copy of this item. This is required to publish updates to it.\n\nWould you like to create one?
infotexts.ItemInstallRequired: You do not have this item installed. This is required to publish updates to it.\n\nWould you like to install it?
infotexts.FreeWeekendCantPublish: You're currently playing Barotrauma through a free weekend.\n\nOnly players who have purchased the game can publish items to the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.FamilySharedCantPublish: You're currently playing Barotrauma via Family Sharing.\n\nOnly players who have purchased the game can publish items to the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.ModDownloadHeader: The following mods are missing or mismatched and are required to play on this server:
infotexts.ModDownloadFooter: Would you like to download them?
infotexts.ModDownloadFooterFail: This server does not allow users to download its mods directly. You may need to visit the Steam Workshop to download them, or contact the server host.
infotexts.SubscribeToAllOnWorkshop: Subscribe to all on Steam Workshop
infotexts.OpenLocalModInExplorer: Local mod\nClick to open in Explorer
infotexts.ViewModDetailsUpdateAvailable: An update to this item is available!\nClick to view details
infotexts.ModUpdatesAvailable: Updates available! Click here to install
infotexts.ModServerExesAtYourOwnRisk:
Modded server executables could be unsafe or malicious.

YOU RUN MODDED SERVER EXECUTABLES AT YOUR OWN RISK.

infotexts.CannotChangeMods: You may only enable/disable mods in the main menu.
infotexts.Ugc.TransferDesc:
It looks like you've created some mods in an old version of Barotrauma.

Please select which of these mods you would like to transfer to the new local mods directory.

Any non-transferred mods will remain inaccessible to this version of the game, but may still be found in their original locations among the game's files should you choose to transfer them yourself manually.
infotexts.PlayerIsDownloadingFiles: This player is downloading files from the server.
infotexts.MergeModsDesc: You are about to merge the following mods:
infotexts.ContentPackageEnableError: The content package "[packagename]" could not be enabled due to an error. Check the debug console by pressing F3 for more details.
infotexts.ModUpdatesAvailableLabel: Updates available! Click here for more details
infotexts.ModLoadOrderExplanation: You can change the load order of the mods by rearranging the list. Mods at the top of the list have a higher priority than the ones below them, meaning that if multiple mods override the same content, the one highest on the list takes precedence over the others.
infotexts.restartrequiredgeneric: You need to restart the game for the changes to take effect.
infotexts.unsavedchangesverification: Are you sure you want to leave without saving the changes made to the settings?\n\nKeep fighting instead!
infotexts.corepackagerequiredwarning: You cannot deselect the content package because it is a core package required for the game to work. You may switch it by selecting another core package.
infotexts.cannotremovecontentpackagesub: Cannot remove the submarine file because it's a part of the content package "[contentpackage]." Please uninstall the content package through the Steam Workshop menu.
infotexts.settingresetverification: Are you sure you want to reset the settings?
infotexts.incorrectexe: The executable you have launched is not present in the content package [selectedpackage]. Do you want to launch [exename]?
infotexts.applysettingsquestion: Do you want to apply the settings or discard the changes?
infotexts.restartrequiredresolution: You need to restart the game for the resolution changes to take effect.
infotexts.restartrequiredlanguage: You need to restart the game for the language change to take effect.
infotexts.incompatiblecontentpackage: Content package "[packagename]" is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma. The package was made for the version [packageversion]; your game version is [gameversion].
infotexts.incompatiblecontentpackageunknownversion: Content package "[packagename]" is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma. The package was made for an unknown version; your game version is [gameversion].
infotexts.contentpackagemissingcorefiles: Content package "[packagename]" is marked as a core package but does not contain all the required files for a core package. Missing content file types: [missingfiletypes]
infotexts.contentpackagecantmakecorepackage: Content package "[packagename]" cannot be marked as a core package because it does not contain all the required files for a core package. Missing content file types: [missingfiletypes]
infotexts.pauseonfocuslosttooltip: Pauses the game when its window is not in focus. Note that the game won't be paused when a multiplayer session is active.
infotexts.voipcapturedevicenotfound: Could not start voice capture; suitable capture device not found.
infotexts.contentpackagehaserrors: Errors found in content package "[packagename]"; some of its features may not work correctly.
infotexts.restartrequiredcontentpackage: You need to restart the game for some content package changes to take effect.
infotexts.enablevsynctooltip: Synchronizes the game's frame rate with your monitor's refresh rate. Helps prevent screen tearing artifacts.
infotexts.lightmapscaletooltip: Lower values improve performance, but cause shadows to appear more pixellated.
infotexts.specularlightingtooltip: Enables specular lighting, an effect which creates brighter spots of light on shiny objects.
infotexts.chromaticaberrationtooltip: Enables a subtle color distortion effect at the edges of the screen.
infotexts.enabletexturecompressiontooltip: Significantly reduces the amount of video memory used by textures. This may increase loading times and generate visual artifacts.
infotexts.radialdistortiontooltip: Enables the fisheye screen distortion effect that's caused by certain afflictions and environmental hazards.
infotexts.muteonfocuslosttooltip: Mutes the game when its window is not in focus.
infotexts.localvoicebydefault: Use local voice chat by default
infotexts.localvoicebydefaulttooltip: When enabled, your voice will be sent through the local voice chat (meaning that only nearby players can hear you). You can use the push-to-talk key to speak through the radio.
infotexts.currentdevicetooltip.osx: This device will be used for voice chat. Unfortunately there is no way to change the input device on Mac OS X—it will only use your system's default.
infotexts.refreshdefaultdevicetooltip: Refreshes the input device used for voice chat. If you swap/hotplug the default input on your system then press this to detect that change.
infotexts.voicemode.pushtotalktooltip: Voice activity is sent only when a certain key is held down.
infotexts.voicemode.activitytooltip: Voice activity is sent whenever the sound coming through surpasses the noise gate threshold.
infotexts.directionalvoicechattooltip: When enabled, voice chat messages are panned according to the direction of the speaker relative to your position.
infotexts.dynamicrangecompressiontooltip: Adjusts the game's volume automatically to prevent audio distortion.
infotexts.voipattenuationtooltip: Lowers the game's volume when players are speaking.
infotexts.cutoffpreventiontooltip: Continues voice transmission for a certain amount of time after the push-to-talk key has been released or the voice activity goes under the threshold.
infotexts.aimassisttooltip: Affects how close the cursor has to be to an item to highlight it. If set to 0%, the cursor has to be exactly on the item.
infotexts.enablemouselooktooltip: When enabled, the camera moves according to the direction you point the cursor to.
infotexts.setdefaultbindingstooltip: Set key bindings to the recommended default settings (left mouse button to select items, right mouse button or esc to deselect).
infotexts.setlegacybindingstooltip: Set key bindings to ones that were used in the old pre-alpha versions of Barotrauma (E to select and deselect items, left mouse button to use item the in hand).
infotexts.duplicatebindwarning: You have bound [savedbind] to [key]. It overlaps with the new keybind [defaultbind]. This can lead to unexpected behavior. Consider revisiting your keybinds in the settings.
infotexts.resetingamehintstooltip: Are you sure you want to reset in-game hints? This will allow the game to show you hints that you've previously set to not be shown again.
infotexts.serversettingsminrespawntooltip: What percentage of players has to be dead/spectating until a respawn shuttle is dispatched.
infotexts.serversettingsrespawndurationtooltip: The amount of time respawned players have to navigate the respawn shuttle to the main spaceship. After the duration expires, the shuttle will exit the level.
infotexts.serversettingsusetraitorratio: Use % of players for max traitors
infotexts.serversettingstraitorsminplayercounttool: How many players need to join the server before traitors can appear.
infotexts.serverrestartrequiredcontentpackage: Before hosting a server, you need to restart the game for the content package changes to take effect.
infotexts.hostserverkarmasettingtooltip: Enabling this will disable Karma.\n\nKarma is a customizable automatic moderation system that gives you an invisible score based on helpful and harmful actions you've performed and may apply certain penalties if your score gets too low. Karma can help in keeping your public servers in check, but with friends, you may want to interact more freely.
infotexts.serversettingsmaximumtransferrequesttool: How much money players are allowed to request from the bank. Setting to 0 will completely disable requesting money from the bank by voting.
infotexts.serversettingslootedmoneydestinationtool: Choose whether looting corpses sends the money to the bank or to the looter's personal wallet.
infotexts.serversettingsenabledosprotectiontooltip: Automatically kick players who cause the server to perform slowly.
infotexts.serversettingsmaxpacketamounttooltip: How many network messages the client is allowed to send per minute before they will get automatically kicked.
infotexts.packetlimit: How many network messages the client is allowed to send per minute before they will get automatically kicked.
infotexts.packetlimitwarning: WARNING: Setting the limit this low may kick legitimate players.
infotexts.dosprotectionkicked: Kicked for causing the server to perform slowly.
infotexts.packetlimitkicked: Kicked for sending too much data to the server. If you weren't intentionally spamming the server, it could be the server is using mods or custom settings that cause the game to send higher-than-normal amounts of data, and the host may need to increase the rate limiter kick threshold or set it to "no limit" in the server settings.
infotexts.settings.campaigndisabled: These settings cannot be modified when a campaign is running.
infotexts.serversettingsskilllosspercentageondeath: How much a character's skills drop toward their job's default skills when they die
infotexts.tabmenu.characterchangespending: Changes to your character will be applied after the current round ends.
infotexts.roundsummarygameover: The stars have claimed the [sub] and its crew.
infotexts.divingsuitwarning: Caution: Micrometeor size exceeds diving suit capabilities.
infotexts.head: Head
infotexts.name: Name
infotexts.deletedialogquestion: Are you sure you want to delete "[file]"?
infotexts.steamdllnotfound: Initializing Steam client failed (steam_api64.dll not found). All Steam features have been disabled—you will not be able to use the Steam Workshop or join servers that use Steam.
infotexts.steamclientinitfailed: Initializing Steam client failed. Please make sure Steam is running and you are logged in to an account. All Steam features have been disabled—you will not be able to use the Steam Workshop or join servers that use Steam.
infotexts.genericreplaceverification: Do you want to replace it?
infotexts.debugconsolehelptext: Debug console—press F3 to open/close; enter "help" for a list of available commands
infotexts.xmlfileinvalid: File "[filepath]" is not a valid XML file ([errormessage]).
infotexts.openlinkinbrowserprompt: Do you want to open the link "[link]" in your web browser?
infotexts.contentpackagemismatchwarninggeneric: This spaceship may not be compatible with the currently selected content packages. Are you sure you want to choose this spaceship?
infotexts.crushdepthwarninglow: This route may be too deep to traverse safely without upgrading the durability of your current ship's hull. Please either upgrade your ship's hull or utilize a more suitable sub. The size of dust particles in this area are [initialdepth] micrometers, but your current hull can only withstand a hit of [submarinecrushdepth] micrometers.
infotexts.crushdepthwarninghigh: You cannot traverse this route without upgrading the durability of your current ship's hull. Please either upgrade your ship's hull or utilize a more suitable sub. The size of dust particles in this area are [initialdepth] micrometers, but your current hull can only withstand a hit of [submarinecrushdepth] micrometers.
infotexts.navterminalicespirewarning: Large asteroid detected. Destroying it via the ship's on-board weapons or switching to manual steering is advised.
infotexts.savenameinusetext: Please choose another name for the save file
infotexts.campaignstarting: Waiting for the campaign to start.
infotexts.campaignsubtooexpensive: This spaceship is too expensive to purchase with the starting balance. If you choose it, you will start with 0 marks, and there's a chance the campaign will be easier than intended.
infotexts.campaignsubincompatible: This spaceship has not been marked as compatible with the campaign mode. There's a chance this spaceship will make the campaign unbalanced or impossible to complete.
infotexts.shuttlewarning: Most shuttles are not adequately equipped to deal with the dangers of the Europan depths. Are you sure you want to choose a shuttle as your vessel?
infotexts.contentpackagemismatchwarning: The spaceship may not be compatible with the currently selected content packages, because it requires the content packages [requiredcontentpackages]. Are you sure you want to choose this spaceship?
infotexts.campaignstartfailedsubnotfound: Failed to start a campaign. Spaceship [subname] not found.
infotexts.campaignfiletransferinprogress: Please wait for the campaign save file to finish downloading.
infotexts.endcampaignverification: Are you sure you want to quit the campaign? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.campaignmode.missingcontentpackage: The content package "[missingcontentpackage]" was in use when saving the campaign, but is not currently enabled.
infotexts.campaignmode.missingcontentpackages: The content packages [missingcontentpackages] were in use when saving the campaign, but are not currently enabled.
infotexts.campaignmode.incompatiblecontentpackage: The content package "[incompatiblecontentpackage]" was not in use when saving the campaign.
infotexts.campaignmode.incompatiblecontentpackages: The content packages [incompatiblecontentpackages] were not in use when saving the campaign.
infotexts.campaignmode.contentpackageordermismatch: The load order of the content packages was different when saving the campaign ([loadorder]).
infotexts.campaignmode.contentpackagemismatchwarni: Content package mismatches may cause errors or crashes. You may want to switch to the correct packages before continuing the campaign.
infotexts.campaignmode.incompatiblesave: The save file is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma.
infotexts.campaignmode.savenotreceived: Accessing the campaign save file from the server, please wait...
infotexts.undefinedsubmarineclasswarning: Spaceships with an undefined class cannot be used in the campaign!\n\nAre you sure you want to save the spaceship without assigning a class?
infotexts.undefinedsubmarineselected: Spaceships with an undefined class cannot be used in the campaign!
infotexts.nohashsubmarineselected: This spaceship doesn't have a valid hash; you may need to wait to download it from the server!
infotexts.campaignoption.enableradiation.tooltip: The radiation belts around Jupiter are slowly becoming more intense, forcing Europans to delve deeper below the moon's icy crust. In practice, this feature slowly pushes you toward the more dangerous areas of the game, ensuring a gradual increase in difficulty.
infotexts.campaignoption.enablehardcore.tooltip: A challenge for expert sailors. Difficulty is increased. Characters gain more experience, but all character progress is lost on death.
infotexts.campaignoption.enabletutorial.tooltip: Start the game in a tutorial outpost and learn the basics of navigating through the campaign mode!
infotexts.radiationtooltip: LETHAL RADIATION\nThe intensity of Jovian radiation has reached lethal levels in this area. Travelling inside the area is strongly díscouraged.
infotexts.nomissionprompt: There are missions available, but you haven't selected any. Are you sure you want to depart without a mission?
infotexts.campaignstore.sellvaluetooltip: When buying things from you, merchants will always offer you less than what you paid for them. Item sell value is further affected by the merchant's balance and your reputation at the outpost, as well as slightly by the mood of the merchant.

infotexts.walletdescription: The wallet is a personal storage for money that can be freely spent on various outpost services.
infotexts.bankdescription: The bank is shared storage for money that cannot be lost on death. Players with permissions can also use the bank as an extension to their wallet when they lack sufficient funds.

infotexts.toofarfromoutpostwarning: To whoever's out there swimming below the outpost, please head back immediately. It's not safe out there.

Hey! You there, below the outpost—what the hell do you think you're doing? I saw you on the sonar and thought you were a crawler for a second! Get back here before someone with an itchier trigger finger gets you killed.
To the diver below the outpost: Head back immediately. You're almost out of sonar range, and I really don't want to send a rescue team to save your ass when you get yourself lost.
infotexts.handcuffequipconfirmation: Are you sure you want to handcuff yourself?
infotexts.autocontroltip: When the light is on, this device is controlled elsewhere.

infotexts.reactortemptip: The reactor isn't generating enough heat to match the turbine's output.
infotexts.reactoroutputtip: The reactor is outputting excess power, which will cause damage to devices in the power grid.
infotexts.killedbytraitornotification: Your death was caused by a traitor on a secret mission…

infotexts.servertagdescription.casual: Having fun is more important than completing the objective. A good choice for new players.
infotexts.servertagdescription.serious: The crew should focus on working together efficiently and completing their objective. No unnecessary messing around.
infotexts.servertagdescription.roleplay: The crew should aim to act like a real spaceship crew. Chain of command is important, as is taking care of your responsibilities and following orders. Speaking out-of-character should be avoided when a round is running.
infotexts.servertagdescription.somethingdifferent: Gameplay differs significantly from the usual Barotrauma gameplay. Modded servers, very unconventional subs, battle royale rounds, shuttle racing, deathrun maps... Anything goes!
infotexts.servertagdescription.rampage: Get ready to fight for your life! A server heavily geared toward combat. This can mean player-versus-player combat, PvE or both—the server description should include guidelines as to what kind of violence is allowed on the server.

infotexts.campaignsavetransfer.timeout: Failed to start the campaign round (timed out while waiting for the latest campaign save from the server). This may be caused by a bad connection and/or an abnormally large save file.
infotexts.clientpermission.managecampaign.descript: Allowed to manage all aspects of the campaign (saving, loading, map, buying and selling, money, hires).
infotexts.clientpermission.karmaimmunity.descripti: Immune to the effects of the karma system.
infotexts.clientpermission.sellinventoryitems.desc: Sell items from your own inventory in the campaign stores.
infotexts.clientpermission.sellsubitems.descriptio: Sell items from the spaceship in the campaign stores.
infotexts.clientpermission.managemap.description: Choose the destination and missions in the campaign mode.
infotexts.clientpermission.managemoney.description: Access the crew's shared funds in the bank and distribute mission rewards to the crew in the campaign mode.
infotexts.clientpermission.managehires.description: Hire new crewmembers or fire members of the current crew.
infotexts.clientpermission.spamimmunity.descriptio: Immune to being automatically kicked for sending too many network messages or spamming the chat.
infotexts.permissionpresetdescription.admin: Allowed to ban and kick players, manage round settings, access server logs and use nearly all console commands.
infotexts.permissionpresetdescription.moderator: Allowed to manage round settings, kick players and access server logs.
infotexts.autoloadout_description: Modify the quantity of items to be spawned on the sub initially
infotexts.submarinetier.description: Higher tier spaceships are more advanced, costlier and better equipped than lower-tier spaceship. They can also be upgraded further than lower tier spaceships.
infotexts.submarineclass.description: A spaceship's class describes what kinds of tasks it was primarily designed for. The class also affects how far certain features of the spaceship can be upgraded.
infotexts.submarinetierandclass.description: A spaceship tier and class affect the number of available upgrades, as well as the maximum upgrade level per category. Higher tier spaceship can be upgraded further than lower tier spaceships. Class can raise the maximum upgrade level of matching categories even higher.
infotexts.submarineclass.scout.description: Scout class spaceships are fast and agile. Their engines and turret visibility ranges can be upgraded further than other classes, and they support mineral scanner installations.
infotexts.submarineclass.attack.description: Designed for combat, attack spaceships are tough and heavily armed. Their turrets can be upgraded further than other classes.
infotexts.submarineclass.transport.description: Transport spaceships have plenty of space for cargo and are well equipped for collecting and processing resources. Their fabricators, deconstructors and fuel efficiency can be upgraded further than other classes, and they support mineral scanner installations.
infotexts.submarine.description.humpback: A former military vessel, WH4-L3 "Humpback" has been outfitted to withstand most of the dangers in deep Europa. Her relatively high velocity is offset by low maneuverability. As she's still boasting an older model reactor, power needs to be supplemented by a backup battery array or the crew will find themselves unable to run all of the new equipment.
infotexts.submarine.description.bunyip: Latest in the line of personnel transports, Bunyip is capable of ferrying crew between spaceships and installations. Its operating radius is considerably lower than its more advanced cousins and no weapons on board makes it vulnerable to attacks.
infotexts.submarine.description.muikku: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.submarine.description.orca: With a relatively high top speed and fantastic ascent and descent characteristics due to her 3 large ballast tanks, Orca class subs are agile vessels, let down only by their small compliment of weapons, unreliable engine and reactors with a greater than average hunger for fuel.
infotexts.submarine.description.remora: A range of customization options are available for Remora. In this model, some of the main hull space has been replaced by a detachable ballast and a remote-controlled drone. A large crew is needed to operate this spaceship.
infotexts.submarine.description.typhon: Typhon class subs are known for their brutish appearance, reasonable array of light and heavy firepower, and their general dependability. Any captain should be aware of their poor rate of descent and unimpressive top speed.
infotexts.submarine.description.dugong: Compared to larger vessels, the Dugong series is overshadowed in all aspects except one: Their reliability for their price is world class. They're lacking in firepower and speed, so smart maneuvering is key.
infotexts.submarine.description.selkie: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.submarine.description.venture: Originally intended as research vessels, Venture shuttles have been co-opted as a more robust alternative for travel between outposts and spaceships.
infotexts.submarine.description.kastrull: The Kastrull is a dependable attack sub class bringing plenty of firepower to any fight, and although it's not very nimble, it does sport a drone gunship as standard. Keep in mind that with its experimental open ballast tanks, low tolerance to flooding and numerous crew stations, a large, experienced crew will get the most out of this sub.
infotexts.submarine.description.hemulen: For when you need extra room to stretch your legs or want some space between you and the poor, choose Hemulen shuttles.
infotexts.submarine.description.typhon2: Typhon 2 is an overhauled version of the venerable Typhon class of sub. Serving as a heavy gunship, the Typhon 2 class subs remain slow and ugly, but with the benefit of better survivability for their crews.
infotexts.submarine.description.azimuth: Superior speed, sleek design and quality-of-life systems make this spaceship a favorite among wealthy Coalition captains who manage to make it to retirement.
infotexts.submarine.description.r-29: R-29 is a heavyweight transport ship. While not terribly well armed against Europa's underwater denizens, it has been retrofitted with two powerful electric discharge coils. Original design by rav2n.
infotexts.submarine.description.barsuk: Barsuk is a favorite among beginner captains. Using materials out of recycled hulls of destroyed spaceships (many of which were Barsuks anyway) keeps the price of the line down. Over the years, a subculture of Barsuk-enthusiasts has formed around customizing and tuning their vessels.
infotexts.submarine.description.winterhalter: Originally manufactured by Archsteel Yards in New Iapetus, Winterhalter spaceships were only in production for a year until they were acquired by the Coalition for research purposes. Many surviving models come equipped with an onboard research laboratory, and they are heavily armed.
infotexts.submarine.description.herja: With its varied weaponry, Herja spaceships are equipped for encounters against most expected and unexpected run-ins with the denizens of Europa. A reliable workhorse in the Coalition fleet. If a monster nest has been cleared nearby, chances are high that it was a Herja that did the deed.
infotexts.submarine.description.orca2: Successor for the classic Orca series, this spaceship boasts the same three-ballast setup which allows it to ascend and descend with only a moment's notice. Well armed and equipped for a scout vessel, Orca2 is capable of taking on all but the most dangerous denizens of Europa.
infotexts.submarine.description.camel: Easily identified by its two humps, the CML (Cargo & Medical Logistics) spaceship is best known as the Camel. The Camel has an extensive medic bay and ample cargo space, but it handles flooding poorly. The front ballast tank is a liability, and some less-liked crewmembers may have found an untimely death in an "accident" there. Trivia: The two humps are welded to the spaceship during missions, but they can still be detached relatively easily when needed to supply heavier equipment to stations.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.humpback: Type "on" or "off" to either connect batteries to power grid or disconnect them. Enter a number from 0 to 100 to set recharge rate for each battery at once.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.typhon2: Enter a value between 0 and 100 to set battery array recharge rate.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.kastrulldiary1:
Day 1 of the expedition out of Meltwater. We're navigating through a newly discovered gap in the ice, trying to find a shorter route to Novaya Moskva.

It's not the safest of missions, but hopefully it'll be my last. Should be able to retire after this one.

Day 3. Cap says the whole voyage shouldn't take more than six days. By my reckoning that should place us somewhere around halfway there.

Course there's always a chance this cave doesn't actually have an exit and we'll have to turn back.

Day 4. Now if I were a superstitious man, I'd wager that saying the worst outcome in any given situation out loud makes it come true. Turns out this route is a dead end.

Captain is bummed out. I share his disappointment. It'll take a few days longer to get to an outpost now that we have to go back.

Day 8. There was a hole in the ice here. It's gone now. Icebergs must've moved and closed it. We've started broadcasting our position in hopes that someone picks it up. They're joking now, asking me why I chose my last expedition to get lost at sea.

Day 9. We're rationing food and water. Crew is getting ornery.

Day 11? 12? No response. Food's running out. More concerned about water, myself. Don't feel like writing any more.

Day 30-ish, who cares anymore? I'm surrounded by dead men. Pale husks of men slumped on the floor. Some of their eyes still move, but they're dead nonetheless.
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.dugongtransmission:
Replaying last outgoing transmissions.
[2451-3-4 11:33] DG-35 calling for Tara colony. Do you read?
[2451-3-4 11:35] Tara colony, do you read? We're taking heavy hits to our topside!
[2451-3-4 11:35] Look at the size of that thing!
[2451-3-4 12:02] We managed to take down the attacker, but the hull is heavily damaged. Requesting rescue from anyone who receives this call.
[2451-3-4 12:06] Hello?
infotexts.terminalwelcomemsg.traitorletter: This message will be both my farewell and confession. I was tasked to smuggle this sonar beacon on board and turn it on when we were a safe distance away. It turns out it was set to a frequency that attracts monsters. I was promised a shuttle was picking me up when the task was done but they never showed.\n\nThis is the last time I accept a "research assignment" from a big-shoe. Or anyone, for that matter. May they honk in hell.
infotexts.linkwaypoint: Hold space to link to another waypoint
infotexts.idcarddescriptiontooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified description added to their ID card. This can be used to describe additional access levels their card has on the sub.
infotexts.idcardtagstooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified tags added to their ID card. You can, for example, use these tags to limit access to some parts of the sub.
infotexts.spawnpointjobstooltip: Only characters with the specified job will spawn at this spawnpoint.
infotexts.spawnpointtagstooltip: Can be used to refer to the spawnpoint in events and human prefabs.
infotexts.reloadlinkedsubtooltip: Reload the linked spaceship from the specified file
infotexts.linklinkedsub: Hold space to link to a docking port
infotexts.spamfilterkicked: You have been kicked by the spam filter.
infotexts.spamfilterblocked: You have been blocked by the spam filter. Try again after 10 seconds.
infotexts.fabricatorrequiredskills.tooltip: Fabricating the item takes longer if your skills are insufficient.
infotexts.reactortipfissionrate: Increasing the fission rate makes the reactor consume more fuel and generate more heat. The heat is used to spin the turbine, which generates electricity.
infotexts.reactortipturbineoutput: The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. If the output is too high relative to the fission rate, the reactor will cool down, and if too low, it will overheat.
infotexts.reactortiptemperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.reactortipload: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the reactor.
infotexts.reactortippower: How much power is currently being generated by the reactor.
infotexts.reactortipautotemp: When automatic control is on, the reactor will automatically adjust itself according to the power consumption. However, the system is not fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption, so manual adjustments may still be needed.
infotexts.reactor.temperatureboostup: Increase pressure to temporarily increase the temperature of the reactor.
infotexts.reactor.temperatureboostdown: Release pressure to temporarily reduce the temperature of the reactor.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.fuelslots: The reactor needs fuel to generate power. Place one in these slots.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.power: Turns the reactor on or off.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.load: Load is the amount of power the spaceship is currently consuming, and output is the amount the reactor is currently generating. The output should be kept as close to the load as possible.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.fissionrate: Fission rate controls the amount of heat generated, and turbine output controls the amount of power generated from the heat. Try to keep both needles on the green.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.automaticcontrol: When automatic control is on, the reactor will operate itself automatically. However, it reacts to power fluctuations slower than a human operator would be able to.
infotexts.infographic.reactor.temperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.steeringautopilotmaintainpostip: AUTOPILOT ON\nMaintaining position. Choose the position to maintain by clicking on the display.
infotexts.steeringautopilotlocationtip: AUTOPILOT ON\nAutopilot is set to navigate toward [locationname].
infotexts.sonartipactive: When active sonar is on, the transponders send out pings that reflect from nearby obstacles. The pings may also be heard by hostile creatures or enemy submarines.
infotexts.sonartippassive: In passive mode, the sonar only listens to sources of sound and sounds reflected from nearby obstacles without actively sending out pings.
infotexts.powertransfertipovervoltage: When the electrical grid is supplied more power than what is being consumed, the voltage rises, which may cause damage to electrical devices.
infotexts.powertransfertiplowvoltage: When there's not enough power available, the voltage drops, which may cause some devices to shut down.
infotexts.powertransfertipload: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the electrical grid.
infotexts.powertransfertippower: How much power is currently being supplied to the electrical grid.
infotexts.draganddropreports: Drag and drop on a room
infotexts.researchstation.empty.infotext: No material inserted. Insert genetic material.
infotexts.researchstation.refine.infotext: Genetic material detected. Ready to refine. Caution: [taintedprobability]% risk of contamination.
infotexts.researchstation.refine.missingitem: Insufficient material. Insert more genetic material to refine.
infotexts.researchstation.combine.infotext: Unstable combination of materials detected. Proceed with caution.
infotexts.healthitemusetip: Drop items here to use them on the selected limb. You can also use items with the inventory hotkeys or by double-clicking.
infotexts.lowmedicalskillwarning: Low medical skill! The suitable treatments list may be inaccurate.
infotexts.healthlimbname.head: Head
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.damage: You have succumbed to your injuries.

infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.husk: The parasite has taken over your body.
infotexts.self_causeofdeathdescription.disconnecte: You were disconnected from the server.

infotexts.dialogreactortaken: Hands off please! I've got this!

Hey, we don't need two people to steer!

infotexts.dialogignoreminorinjuries: [targetname]'s injuries are so minor I don't think I should waste any meds on them.
[targetname] is mildly injured, but I think they'll manage without my help.
infotexts.dialognorepairtargets: What do you mean? Everything is working all right.
infotexts.dialognopumps: The pumps are okay, aren't they?

infotexts.dialognorescuetargets: No one seems to be in need of medical attention at the moment!

infotexts.dialogcannotreachleak: Can't get to the leak near [name]!
infotexts.dialog.cantupgrade: I'm not able to work on your new spaceship until it has been delivered.
infotexts.dialog.upgradepurchased: Thank you for your purchase! I will start working on your spaceship shortly before you depart.
infotexts.dialogattackedbyfriendly: What the hell are you doing?!
Hey! What do you think you're doing?
infotexts.dialogenteroutpostwarning: Okay, that's far enough. Get back to your sub and leave right now or we'll open fire.
You people are not welcome here. Get the hell out or you'll be leaving in a duffel bag.
infotexts.dialogstealwarning: What do you think you're doing? Put that back!
Thief! Put it back right now and I'll pretend I didn't see anything.
infotexts.dialogattackedbyfriendlysecurityresponse: Do you really want to take that path?
Hey! This is the last warning!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindrequireditemtorepair: Can't find the tools to do the repairs!
I don't have the tools for the repairs!
infotexts.dialogcannotfindfireextinguisher: I need something to help with the fire! Where are all the fire extinguishers?

A torch, a welding torch... Where are you when I need you the most?
infotexts.dialogdamagewallswarning: Hey, what the hell do you think you're doing?!
Stop that or you'll drown us all!
Are you out of your mind? Stop it or you'll flood the whole place!

infotexts.dialoglowonoxygentanks: Almost all the oxygen tanks on the sub are empty! Can we get some of the empty tanks to the oxygen generator for refilling?

This is my last oxygen tank then.

I can't find my way back to the spaceship!

I need someone to fix the navigation terminal!
infotexts.dialogmentalstateconfused: Huh... I must be seeing things.
infotexts.dialogmentalstatedesperate: Shut up. Shut up. Shut up.
infotexts.dialogmentalstateberserk: It will all be over soon.
They won't trouble us for long.
infotexts.dialogmentalstatereactiondefensive: I won't let you take me!
infotexts.dialogmentalstatereactionarrest: I won't let you hurt me!
I have to put you down!
infotexts.dialogterroristannounce: This ship belongs to the Innies!
This ship will serve the Innies well!
You all must die for your crimes against humanity!
The Innies will rule over the Federation!
infotexts.dialogoutofpulselaserammo: We're out of pulse laser fuel.
infotexts.dialoglowonchaingunammo: We're running low on chaingun ammunition! Fire short controlled bursts!
infotexts.dialoglowonpulselaserammo: There's not much pulse laser fuel left onboard.
infotexts.dialoghuskdormant: My throat feels a bit sore.
I think I might have a fever.
I feel really weak. Every muscle hurts.
infotexts.dialoginsufficientpressureprotection: I'm not protected enough from the pressure!
The pressure is breaking up my suit!
I'm getting crushed by the pressure!
infotexts.dialogcannottreatself: I don't have the means to treat myself!
infotexts.dialoglowrepcampaigninteraction: Honestly, I'd rather not do business with you people, but I don't have the luxury of picking my customers.
They say I shouldn't be serving you, but I say I shouldn't be turning down a paying customer.
If I wasn't broke, I'd tell you to piss off. But if you've got the money…
Oh, you're one of those people. Although…if there's marks in your wallet, let's pretend you're just a kind stranger in need of my services.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems: This is a mandatory security inspection. Just a moment.
Someone's been stealing our supplies as of late. I'll just pat you down quick to make sure it wasn't you…
Hey, you! I need to check your pockets. Hold on for a second.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.nostolenitems: Thank you for your cooperation. You're free to go.
Everything's in order. Have a good day!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.warn: What do we have here? Drop the stolen goods and I'll let it slide this time.
Took something that doesn't belong to you, eh? Drop the stolen goods right now!
Thief! Drop the stolen items now or there will be consequences.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.arrest: All right, have it your way then. You're under arrest!
Want to do this the hard way, huh? Fine.
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.comply: You're off the hook for now. But I'll be keeping an eye on you…
Okay, you're free to go. But I'll be keeping an eye on you…

infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.assistant: You're playing an assistant. Assistants are a jack-of-all-trades class. Be helpful where you can and develop your skills.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.captain: You're playing a captain. You should make your way to the command room and start navigating the submarine to the destination.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.engineer: You're playing an engineer. Engineers are responsible for keeping the submarine powered at all times. To do that, tend to the reactor and keep electrical equipment in good condition by repairing them.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.mechanic: You're playing a mechanic. You should keep an eye out on all the devices on the submarine and repair them if they break.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.medicaldoc: You're playing a medical doctor. Take care of your fellow crew and treat their injuries if they hurt themselves.
infotexts.hint.onstartedcontrolling.job.securityof: You're playing a security officer. Take inventory of the weapons on board the submarine, arm the turrets in case of an enemy attack and keep the rowdy crewmembers in line.

infotexts.locationdescription.abandoned: Contact was lost with this outpost.\nRe-establishing contact or eliminating a threat here could net you money.
infotexts.tutorial.tryagain: Do you want to try again?
infotexts.tutorial.radio.speaker: Captain Huskinson
infotexts.tutorialskipwarning: It looks like this might be the first time you've played Barotrauma. We strongly recommend that you give the tutorials a try before starting your journey through the depths of Europa.
infotexts.tutorial.mechanictitle: Mechanic - Glue, duct tape and your nerve are the only things keeping the crew alive.
infotexts.tutorial.mechanicdescription: When the plan goes as planned and the gear works is as probable as the human race leaving this shithole. There are no breaks or rest for you, as everything that can break down, will break down. And if nothing’s broken, then it's maintenance, maintenance, maintenance. Getting to the next destination is all that matters, and you’re the one who delivers. There’s no thank-yous or respect, just snickering and contempt from your "fellow crewmembers"—but that’s okay. This is YOUR survival vessel, and if any of them make it too, well...whoop dee doo for them.
infotexts.tutorial.engineertitle: Engineer - The one who harnesses the power of nature.
infotexts.tutorial.engineerdescription: Power and oxygen, it's like that. Without, the ship don’t move and the lungs won’t breathe. Beyond the fancy talk and costume play, you are the guy who really runs the ship, get it? Trust in the laws of physics and think clear. Also, keep your eye on that damn toy-tinkering wannabe engineer mechanic, and whatever you do, don’t bite into the psycho-babble of the medic. He’s so deep in his softie inner world he’s practically a woman. Captain and security are harmless, and way below your intelligence. Obviously.
infotexts.tutorial.securityofficertitle: Security Officer - The backbone of violence.
infotexts.tutorial.securityofficerdescription: It is said that pressure brings out the worst in people. Not everybody has your moral strength—hell, most of them are so crooked that it’s questionable if they even should be allowed to live. Channel the crew’s anger toward the creatures outside, but never fool yourself into trusting them. Keep the nukes ready, the handcuffs available, and every now and then put someone in the brig just so they know who’s in charge!
infotexts.tutorial.medicaldoctortitle: Medical Doctor - Maintaining the key resource: the people
infotexts.tutorial.medicaldoctordescription: Guns and engines and reactors don't keep the ship running—people do. It’s up to you to keep the gunner alive to man the guns and captain alive to steer the ship. And remember, your job goes well beyond the physical. We live crammed into tight spaces, under ice, in the sea. When the lights go out and your "buddies" go to sleep, all kinds of dark shit crawls into their minds. Keep them alive and sane, or put them down like dogs. It’s up to you.
infotexts.tutorial.captaintitle: Captain - Naval visionary, seafarer, a genius. Possibly.
infotexts.tutorial.captaindescription: Captain Ahab once said, "Hell is an idea first born on an undigested apple-dumpling." Do you know what that means? No. Does the crew think you are a mysterious genius? Hell yeah. This job is at least as much appearing to know what to do as actually knowing what to do. You are the map and the compass, the guy with the big picture. Navigate and make the tough calls. And remember, you’re just a few steps away from being the mayor of an outpost, and if a couple fellows need to die for that—so be it!
infotexts.tutorial.basics.message.1: “Ah, I see you're standing. I'd like to keep this brief, since you're the sixth person I've had to guide today, and frankly I'm getting tired of it.”
infotexts.tutorial.basics.message.2: “You're in an automated rehabilitation chamber. You've suffered a traumatic experience and were in a perpetual state of screaming and defecating your boiler suit. Dr. Happy has seen fit to treat you.”
infotexts.tutorial.basics.message.3: “That's great news! And significantly reduces the chance of intense nightmares and flashbacks, too. It's an intended but slightly inconvenient side effect of your medication. We just have to re-teach you all the basics, like using your arms and legs, and you're good to go and make some money to pay your medical bills!”
infotexts.tutorial.basics.message.4: “Anyways, let's get you going. Try to move those arms and legs, will you? The door will open once you press the button. It's slightly out of reach, though.”
infotexts.tutorial.basics.endmessage.1: “Ah shit, we didn't think you'd get this far so soon... This sector is unfortunately still quite unfinished, as you can see. There used to be a Mudraptor nest here, but we're 90% sure they're all gone.”
infotexts.tutorial.basics.endmessage.2: “Hold on a second... I see some additional movement on a camera. Uh oh...”
infotexts.tutorial.basics.wasd: Use [InputType.Up], [InputType.Left], [InputType.Down], and [InputType.Right] to move your character.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.looking: Use the cursor to control the direction your character is facing.\nPress [InputType.Use] to close this instruction.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.cursor: Use [InputType.Select] to interact with buttons, doors and objects.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.highlight: Interactable objects are highlighted when the cursor moves over them.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.obtain: To pick up an item, point at it with the cursor and use [InputType.Select].
infotexts.tutorial.basics.lockeddoor: Locked doors require an ID card to get through.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.stairsusage: Press [InputType.Down] to drop down the platform, onto the stairs.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.repair: Devices sometimes break down. They can be repaired with the correct repair tool.\nPress [InputType.Use] to close this instruction.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.containers: Items can be found in containers. Use the cursor and [InputType.Select] to open a container.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.equip: Double-click an item to equip it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.equip2: Items in your hotbar can also be equipped by pressing the corresponding hotbar number (1-9).
infotexts.tutorial.basics.waitdrain: Well done! Wait for the pump to drain the room.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.repairouchie: Ouch! Time your repairs by clicking the repair button when the line is in the colored section of the bar.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.weldingtool: Welding tools are vital equipment for sealing leaks. Obtain a welding tool.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.weldingfuel: Welding tools need welding fuel to work. Get a welding fuel tank from the container.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.insertweldingfuel: Drag a Welding Fuel Tank onto the Welding Tool to insert it.\nAlternatively press the hotbar number of the Welding Fuel Tank to insert it, while you have the tool equipped.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.insertweldingfuelalt: Alternatively, while you have a welding tool equipped, press the welding fuel tank's hotbar number to insert it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.aimandfire: To aim your tool or weapon, hold the [InputType.Aim] button, then press [InputType.Shoot] to use or fire it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.holdaim: Hold the [InputType.Aim] button to aim toward the cursor.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.ladders: Use [InputType.Up] and [InputType.Down] while near a ladder to go up or down it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.welding: Weld the leaking wall to continue.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.divingsuits: Diving Suits allow you to swim underwater.\n\nEquip a Diving Suit by double clicking it, or dragging it on the highlighted slot.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.divingsuits2: Equip a diving suit by double-clicking it or dragging it onto the highlighted slot.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.nooxygen: WARNING! Your diving suit is empty, preventing you from breathing. Quickly find an oxygen tank and insert it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.oxygen: Wearing a diving suit slowly drains its oxygen tank.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.oxygen2: When an oxygen tank is almost empty, your diving suit will sound the alarm.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.oxygen3: You're running low on oxygen! To unequip the diving suit, drag it out of the inventory slot.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.righttool: Pumps are a mechanical device. Mechanical devices require a Wrench to repair.\nFind a Wrench.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.wrenchrepair: Equip the wrench to be able to repair the pump.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.interact2: Press [InputType.Select] to interact with the pump or other interactable devices.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.puzzle: Using the pump's interface, see if you can get up the ladder...
infotexts.tutorial.basics.puzzlehelp: By setting the pump to pump water into the room, you will be able to swim to the ladder.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.equipoxygentank: Drag the oxygen tank on top of your equipped diving suit in your inventory to insert the tank into it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.pumpcontrols: Use the pump controls to pump water into the room. Press the power button to turn on the pump if needed.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.drop: You can drop items simply by dragging them out of your inventory.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.unequipdivingsuitdrag: Unequip your diving suit by dragging it out of its inventory slot.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.unequipdivingsuitclick: Unequip your diving suit by double-clicking the inventory slot or by clicking the green button above it.
infotexts.tutorial.basics.objective6: Wait for the room to drain
infotexts.tutorial.basics.objective10: Insert oxygen into the diving suit
infotexts.tutorial.basics.objective13: Use the pump to flood the room
infotexts.tutorial.basics.popup.obtainitems: Your inventory is shown at the bottom.\nTo get the screwdriver into your inventory, drag it there.\nAlternatively, double-click to obtain an item faster.
infotexts.tutorial.basic.description: This tutorial teaches basic controls and game concepts, such as moving and interacting with the environment.
infotexts.tutorial.basic.completed: Well done!\nYou've completed the Basics tutorial. Do you want to continue to the Roles tutorial?
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.1: “Oh hey—how's it floating, dude? You here to get your papers to sign on a submarine?”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.2: “Whoa, such enthusiasm, dude! I love it! Are you familiar with the courses we offer?”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.3_skip: “All righty dude, just chill in the next room until the other students arrive. Lemme open that door for ya.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.3: “Ah, you know dude, just the thingamajig politician dude in his ivory tower trying to solve a problem...without actually solving the problem, ya know?”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.4: “The submarine business—it ain't all that, you feel me? Ain't many that return from a trip. Ain't any that return from ten trips. So there's a 100% discount on whatever passes as education here, 'cus that'll solve things.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.5: “I'm just the reception dude, dude. Ain't my job to get meat for the grinder. Want my advice? Take a station job—fight back against the system, dude.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.5_player: “But I want to find adventure! Besides, there's no food here...”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.6a: “Suit yourself, dude... We offer five courses here:\n\nFirst off, the Captain. If ya feel like delegating all the shitty tasks, this is for you. Highly recommend.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.6b: “Sure, dude. Then there's the fixin' duo.\nThe Engineer gets all the fancy toys, but with a high risk of bein' shocked. Ain't for the weak hearted.\nThen there's the Mechanic, if ya don't mind getting wet. He's doing the welding and pump-fixing kind of things. Ain't recommended for smokers, feel me?”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.6c: “Yeah, awful right? Then there's the Security Officer, if you like shooting the creepies. They're usually too in love with their power, though. I actually got this tattoo that says ASOAB. Means 'All Security Officers Are Bastards.' Watch out with those dudes, dude.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.message.6d: “Finally, there's the Medical Doctor. Most of 'em are creepier than the actual creepies, but some actually make people better, man. They're some literal saints, feel me?\nAnyhow, if ya still interested, move on to the next room.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.moveright: Move to the room on the right to continue.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.creworders: Use [InputType.CrewOrders] to toggle the list of crewmembers.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.creworders2: Select a trainee position from the list of crewmembers with [InputType.Select].
infotexts.tutorial.roles.idcarddescription: This ID card gives the trainee access to the training areas.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captaindescription: The Captain steers the submarine, operates the sonar and issues commands to the crew.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.engineerdescription: The Engineer operates the nuclear reactor to generate power and maintains electrical devices. Skilled engineers can add custom functionality to submarines with custom wiring and signal components.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.mechanicdescription: The Mechanic maintains the mechanical devices, such as the engine and pumps, to keep the submarine moving smoothly. Additionally, any leaks in the hull are typically fixed by mechanics, as they have superior welding skills.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.securitydescription: The Security Officer protects the submarine and crew from external and internal threats. With a combination of ship-mounted and handheld weapons, and the skills to use them, they're the first line of defense.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.medicdescription: The Medical Doctor treats the ailments of the crew. This ranges from bandaging small wounds to administering drugs. In a worst-case scenario, fallen crewmembers can be saved with CPR.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.startprompt_captain: Start the tutorial for the Captain?
infotexts.tutorial.roles.startprompt_engineer: Start the tutorial for the Engineer?
infotexts.tutorial.roles.startprompt_mechanic: Start the tutorial for the Mechanic?
infotexts.tutorial.roles.startprompt_security: Start the tutorial for the Security Officer?
infotexts.tutorial.roles.startprompt_medic: Start the tutorial for the Medical Doctor?
infotexts.tutorial.roles.reception_notification: “Hey dude, the teacher is ready for ya.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.start: To start the tutorial, find your instructor at the marked location.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captaininstructor: “Hi. I am Captain Sterner. I will be your instructor today. I will start with a brief explanation of what it means to be a captain, followed by a practical course. It is crucial to enforce a chain of command, so you will address me as 'Captain.' Say 'Yes, Captain' if you understand.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.commandroomdescription: “The Command Room is the brains of the submarine. From here signals are passed—either verbally or electronically—to crew and devices.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.commandroomdescription2: “Using devices like the navigation terminal and status monitor, the captain can pass all these signals, for example: Order the crew to fix devices, signal the engine to move at full power, or empty the ballast tanks to raise the submarine.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal: “The core function of the navigation terminal is to move the submarine.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_sonar: “Since we're in a low-light environment, sonar is the most efficient way of identifying terrain, objects and lifeforms.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_sonar2: “Sonar is short for 'sound navigation and ranging.' Sonar has two modes: passive and active.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_sonar3: “While in 'passive' mode, the sonar only listens to sounds. It will still detect things, especially if these things make a lot of sound. Static objects or terrain, however, won't be detected until very close.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_sonar4: “While in 'active' mode, the sonar emits pulses of sound at an interval. Simply put, this means every few seconds, the sound wave will reveal terrain, objects and lifeforms. Active sonar is essential to avoid bumping into terrain while moving at any decent speed.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_sonar5: “Finally, there's the directional ping. While active sonar is great for spotting things, it's also great for being spotted. The directional ping limits the direction of the sound pulse, thus preventing hostiles from spotting your submarine—as long as it's not aimed at them.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_sonar6: “We've hooked up this navigation terminal to a sonar. Feel free to try it out.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.navigationterminal_: Use [InputType.Select] to interact with the navigation terminal.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_steeri: “Once you have a bearing on your surroundings, it is time to move the submarine.”
“Steering is controlled with the display in the middle, which utilizes modern touchcreen and auto-pilot technologies.”
“By default, the auto-pilot will try to maintain the submarine's position. By touching (clicking) the screen, the auto-pilot's target position will change to the indicated position.”

“Furthermore, the auto-pilot has information on outpost locations. It attempts to automatically navigate to predefined positions. This system, however, is neither infallible nor as quick as manual steering.”
“Speaking of manual steering: This is the preferred option for those who want more control over their submarine. By touching (clicking) the screen, you set the submarine's target velocity.”

“For example: If you want your submarine to move slowly to the right, you touch slightly to the right of the submarine's current position. If you want to rise up quickly, you touch far above the submarine's current position.”

“Trick question! No you're not, cadet! A submarine is usually docked while idle, to prevent it from drifting and using fuel. First, you'll need to undock using the big red "Undock" button. Easy, right? Now, let's try it out.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.navigationterminal_: Undock the drone, using the Shuttle Navigation Terminal.
Practice steering the drone. Re-dock the drone when ready.\nTo dock, align the docking hatches (marked in green). Press Dock once the button flashes.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.navigationterminal_comman: “Not bad, cadet. You are ready to be a helmsman now, but being a captain is more than that.”

“You cannot run a large submarine by yourself. You need a crew. And a crew needs someone to lead them, or they will stumble around like headless chickens. Cluck cluck cluck. Wait, they wouldn't... Never mind.”
“As captain, you're responsible for leading your crew. So you'll have to issue orders to them. Meaning, you'll need to know what needs doing!”

“That's where the status monitor comes in. With the status monitor, you can see where the submarine is in need of repairs. You can then mark these rooms with tasks and pray there's someone competent enough to perform them. Don't skip the praying part.”
“If you don't want shit to break down in the first place though, you'll have to tell your crew to keep it all in good order. This means issuing them orders from the get-go.”
“Let's try it out on an actual submarine, shall we? The other cadets ought to be ready right about now. Follow me.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_follow: Follow Captain Sterner into the submarine.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captaininstructor_start: “We're here. Let's start by issuing commands to the crew. Without power, nothing in the submarine will work, so first order the reactor turned on.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_command2: Order the reactor to be turned on.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_command3: The command interface will automatically select the most qualified crewmember for the assigned task.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_command4: You can also give orders directly to a specific crewmember on the crew list (toggle with [InputType.CrewOrders]).
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captaininstructor_repairs: “Great. Remember—captains should command respect and obedience. That's why they usually carry a firearm. Our last engineer, Stevie Dolittle, said, 'What are you going to do, shoot me?' Haha, his cousin didn't stick around long after that. Anyways, let's order some maintenance, shall we?”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_commandmain: Order electrical devices to be repaired.
Order mechanical devices to be repaired.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captaininstructor_firearm: “And no, you won't be given a firearm yet—you'll have to complete your education first. Let's get on with that, shall we? Honkmother knows you'll need it. Speaking of firearms, it's time to get the sub's weapons operational.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_commandsecu: Order the bottom turret to be operated.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captaininstructor_end: “That covers the basics. Now the real test: Undock from the station, get us to the next outpost, and you'll be done and graduated! Good luck, cadet!”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.captain_graduation: Use what you've learned to reach the next outpost.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captain.objective.drone3: Try out the maintain position controls
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captain.objective.orders3: Order electrical devices to be repaired
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captain.objective.orders4: Order mechanical devices to be repaired
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captain.objective.orders5: Order the bottom turret to be operated
infotexts.tutorial.roles.captain.objective.station: Arrive and dock at the marked station
infotexts.tutorial.roles.engineerinstructor: “Welcome! Welcome! I'm Chief Engineer Friar, but please, call me Kayleigh.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.reactorroomdescription: “The reactor room is where the heart of the submarine resides. As long as there's electrical juices flowing through the wires, there is life in the submarine. And it—the electricity—all originates from this beauty right here.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.engineerinstructor_fuelro: “While 'nuclear reactor' may sound scary, because of the whole invisible radiation thing, there's actually nothing to worry about! Operating reactors is relatively safe.”
“Relative to the other, waaaay more dangerous dangers, that is. The reactor room is usually quite well protected, and it's centrally located!”
“One thing to keep in mind, and I will stress this: Do NOT insert every fuel rod you have in your storage into the reactor all at once.”

“Really. Do not. Each fuel rod increases the amount of heat generated by the reactor. Too much heat means a fire will start. Eventually a full-blown meltdown will trigger, and...KABOOM! Well, at least it's a quick death. Sure beats getting captured by pirates.”
“For now, I'm just going to hand you one fuel rod. Let me show you how to insert it.”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.engineer_fuelrods: Interact with the reactor, then drag the fuel rod into the slots on the left.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.engineerinstructor_reacto:
“A basic start-up of the nuclear reactor looks like this:
1. One non-empty fuel rod inserted.
2. Power button pressed.
3. Automatic control toggled on.”
“Give it a try then! Don't be shy!”
infotexts.tutorial.roles.popup.engineer_reactor: Interact with the reactor, power it up and enable automatic control.
infotexts.tutorial.roles.engineerinstructor_reacto: “Great job! You're a natural! We now have power. Look at how all the lights are turning on—that was all you!”
“Aha, getting confident, are we? Well, let's switch over to manual control then.”
“In manual control, you're using two controls. The first one, on the left, is the fission rate and the second, on the right, is the turbine output.”
“Increasing the fission rate makes the reactor consume more fuel and generate more heat. The heat is used to spin the turbine, which generates electricity.”
“The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. If the output is too high relative to the fission rate, the reactor will cool down; too low and it'll overheat.”
