infotexts.afflictiondescription.acidreaction: Affected by a reagent that drastically increases progression of acid burns and husk infection.
infotexts.entitydescription.tonicliquid: A medical solution that's mildly effective as a treatment for internal damage, but is more commonly used to increase the duration of performance-enhancing drugs.
infotexts.entitydescription.cyanide: A highly toxic chemical that causes a rapid death once a sufficiently large dose has been administered. Can be used as a risky method for eliminating husk infections.
infotexts.entitydescription.sufforin: A stealthy neurotoxin, undetectable in early stages. Causes a loss of vision and, ultimately, death. Can be used as a risky method for eliminating husk infections.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibiotics: An antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with the side effect of internal damage and alcohol sensitivity. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding1: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and, to a lesser extent, burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding2: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds. Very effective against burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibleeding3: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and prevents them from getting infected. Also effective against burns. Use with care, as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.
infotexts.entitydescription.ethanol: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised. Pouring on skin treats mild infections yet causes small burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.rum: A fine liquor made from raptor bane or pomegrenade juice. Some purists insist real rum is made from sugarcane — good luck finding any of that on Europa. Pouring on skin treats mild infections yet causes small burns.
infotexts.entitydescription.deusizine: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation, blood loss and, to a lesser extent, bleeding. Produces mild burns as a side effect.
infotexts.entitydescription.antibloodloss1: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss. Small relief when used on infected tissue.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.huskinfectionresis: Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites, resulting in slower progression of their growth. Does not affect infection chance.
infotexts.entitydescription.adrenaline: A naturally occurring hormone, useful as short-term treatment and prevention for stuns, while also keeping the patient from falling to life-threatening unconsciousness. Can be used to manufacture medicine or combat stimulants.
infotexts.eventtext.soundinthevent.o1: Try to remove the vent cover to take a better look inside.
infotexts.eventtext.soundinthevent.o2: See if you can spot anything unusual…
infotexts.eventtext.stuckinthemiddle.o1.o1.o1.o1.o: Peeking into a side room, you see somebody lying on the floor, handcuffed. Judging by their bloody and swollen face, they've been roughed up pretty thoroughly.
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.c1: Someone has set up shop in the crew module. A sign on the door says “Mike the Scryer: He’ll divine answers to all your questions!” The walls are lined with crudely drawn pictures of monsters, expensive submarines and well-endowed women.\n\nIn the middle of the room is a round table with a couple of empty bottles of Europan moonshine and a crystal ball. A man wearing thick glasses and a sloppily tied turban is sitting behind the table.
infotexts.eventtext.miketheidiot1.o1.c1: He squints and motions you to take a seat. “I’m Mike,” he croaks. “5 marks to ask me anything.”
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.c1: You hear two scientists talking nearby. “…so I just hold down this button?”
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.c1: You reach for the source of the sound. It's a bomb, and it's ticking!
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1: With expert dexterity, you pull some wires to the side and manage to carefully remove the detonator. The ticking stops. The guard from earlier should be interested in seeing this.
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.c2: Your hands shake furiously—you almost drop the bomb. In pure panic, wires are ripped, buttons are pressed and somehow, the timer stops.
infotexts.eventtext.bombscare.o1.o1.o1.c1.o1.o1.c1: Before you can catch your breath, the ticking resumes...and accelerates!
infotexts.editor.layer.selectall: Select all items in this layer
infotexts.editor.layer.tooltip: Toggle, create, delete and rename layers
infotexts.talentdescription.anappleaday: Gain [amount]% resistance to the skill loss upon death, and [amount2]% resistance to extra skill loss when choosing to respawn immediately instead of waiting.
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.securitycheck: A security guard signals you to stop. "Hey you, what was that explosion? Did you see what happened?"
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.noticedweapon: The guard notices the weapon. "I've got a suspect carrying an unidentified alien device!"
infotexts.EventText.explosivemishap.noweapon: "What a mess..." The guard calls over the radio: "We need viscera cleanup detail over here."
infotexts.eventtext.soundinthevent.getscrewdriver: The grate is shut tight. Maybe you could try to unscrew it…
infotexts.eventtext.soundinthevent.getflashlight: It's too dark inside. You can't see anything. Maybe shining some light would help?
infotexts.eventtext.propaganda.o1.o2.c1: You might be a rebel, but you're not an artist. Your "drawing" is too abstract, even for your own crew.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.clowncheckpassed: The clowns hail you as one of their own. You're sure you could convince them to leave the outpost with you.
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.wemustdepart: "Brothers, this settlement has had its fair share of laughs already. It's time for us to depart and move on."
infotexts.eventtext.infiltration.timetoleave: The best jokes are often the shortest. The clowns agree to accompany you.
infotexts.entitydescription.turban: Not the most practical headwear around these parts, but might lend you some sort of aura of mysticality.
infotexts.orderdialog.deconstructitems: [name], start deconstructing items marked for deconstruction!
infotexts.hint.onitemmarkedfordeconstruction: Bots will start going through items marked for deconstruction when you order them to deconstruct items.
infotexts.hint.ondeconstructorder: Bots ordered to deconstruct items will deconstruct anything marked for deconstruction. You can mark items by issuing a contextual command with [InputType.Command].
infotexts.hint.onitemmarkedforrelocation: A bot has left an item inside the outpost. Items such as diving suits dropped by bots and objects they've left in an outpost deconstructor get automatically moved to the submarine when you depart–you don't need to move them manually.
infotexts.itemrelocated: The items the bots left inside the outpost have been automatically moved to the submarine.
infotexts.sp.Fabricator.FabricationSpeed.name: Fabrication speed
infotexts.waterinhullswarning: Some of the hulls have water in them. If this is not intentional, you can remove it using the "water" console command.
infotexts.campaignoption.maxvitalitymultipliercrew: Modifies the maximum vitality of all player crew members in the game.
infotexts.campaignoption.maxvitalitymultipliernonc: Modifies the maximum vitality of all characters who are not members of the player crew.
infotexts.campaignoption.oxygensourcemultiplier.to: Modifies the capacity of all tanks acting as oxygen sources in the game.
infotexts.campaignoption.reactorfuelmultiplier.too: Modifies the duration of all reactor fuels in the game.
infotexts.campaignoption.repairfailmultiplier.tool: Modifies the damage received from failing a repair attempt.
infotexts.campaignoption.showhuskwarning.tooltip: Do you want to be warned that you've contracted the husk infection before it becomes apparent in the health interface?
infotexts.campaignoption.patdownprobability.toolti: Modifies how likely security officers are to inspect player characters for stolen items. These random pat downs can also be turned off entirely.
infotexts.worldhostility.tooltip: Affects how dangerous Europa is. Higher hostility means more numerous or tougher enemies, more environmental hazards and new, challenging mechanics, such as untreated wounds getting infected.
infotexts.ChatSpeechBubbles.tooltip: Should chat messages be displayed in a speech bubble above the speaker?
infotexts.toolargeforendgamewarning: The submarine is so large (> 80m x 32m) that it might not be able to get through some obstacles in the final biome. Switching to a smaller submarine may be required to finish the campaign.
infotexts.entitydescription.nuclearshellcheap: A nuclear shell for use with a railgun. Cheaply crafted by a talented engineer.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleardepthchargechea: A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode. Cheaply crafted by a talented engineer.
infotexts.entitydescription.nucleardepthdecoycheap: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub. Cheaply crafted by a talented engineer.
infotexts.talentdescription.reducedualwieldpenalty: Reduce the penalty for dual-wielding ranged weapons by [amount]%.
infotexts.LowOxygenOutputWarning: The vent in the room [roomname] might not output enough oxygen to compensate one person's oxygen consumption. Consider adding more vents to the room or increasing the output of the oxygen generator.
infotexts.tagdescription.armcab: Safely stores handheld weapons, ammunition and armor.
infotexts.tagdescription.medfabcab: Stores items used in fabricating medical items.
infotexts.tagdescription.reactorcab: Stores fuel rods and items for electrical engineering.
infotexts.tagdescription.secarmcab: Securely stores dangerous handheld weapons, ammunition and armor. Generally locked behind ID card access.
infotexts.tagdescription.supplycab: Stores items that require quick access, such as diving masks and welding fuel.
infotexts.tagdescription.toxcab: Securely stores toxic substances. Generally locked behind ID card access.
infotexts.tagdescription.locker: Tag given to most cabinets or storage elements with an item inventory.
infotexts.tagdescription.researchcontainer: Recommended to add to Research Modules. Contains sciency items that sciency people might use or have lying around.
infotexts.tagdescription.respawncontainer: Used on respawn shuttles; supplies respawn gear.
infotexts.tagdescription.trashcan: Racoons love these—too bad they don't live in Europa. Can contain random items thrown away by wasteful Europans.
infotexts.tagdescription.weaponholder: Stores weapons in a way that's both easily accessed and observed.
infotexts.tagdescription.ruinstorage: Storage used by aliens to house their alien items.
infotexts.tagdescription.ruinstoragelarge: Large storage used by aliens to house their alien items in bulk.
infotexts.tagdescription.ruinstoragesmall: Small storage used by aliens to house their alien items.
infotexts.tagdescription.ruintreasure: Storage used by aliens to house their most valuable items.
infotexts.tagdescription.storageorgan: A thalamus organ where items are kept.
infotexts.tagdescription.coilgunloader: Feeds ammunition boxes into a coilgun.
infotexts.tagdescription.flakcannonloader: Feeds ammunition boxes into a flak cannon.
infotexts.tagdescription.railgunloader: Feeds the railgun's shells into a railgun.
infotexts.containertagui.countwarning: Container tag warning: The tags given to containers do not match the recommended minimum amounts. The missing tags are:\n[tags]
infotexts.containertagui.recommendedamount: Current amount (recommended amount). Ignoring recommendations can lead to issues with item storage.
infotexts.containertagui.recommendedamountwarning: The submarine has less than the recommended amount of this container tag.
infotexts.containertagui.suggestedamount: Current amount (suggested amount). Suggestions can be safe to ignore, depending on the design.
infotexts.containertagui.campaignonlytooltip: Only show probabilities that affect a campaign.
infotexts.containertagui.tutorial: Container tags determine what kinds of items should be spawned when auto fill is selected and tell bots which items go where.
infotexts.containertagui.viewprobabilities: View spawn probabilities of the listed items.
infotexts.containertaguibuttondescription: Configure what kinds of items should be stored in here.
infotexts.predefinedtags.name: Predefined tags
infotexts.afflictiondescription.infection.low: The skin is slightly red and swollen.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.infection: The infected wound is red with streaks of yellow.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.infection.high: The wound is a deep red, swollen and oozes copious amounts of pus.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.drunkweakness.self: You have an increased sensitivity to alcohol as a side effect of medicine usage.
Poisons progress more slowly to the lethal stages.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.adrenalinerush: The rush of adrenaline is keeping the patient conscious and less easily stunned.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.adrenalinerush.sel: The rush of adrenaline is keeping you conscious and less easily stunned.
infotexts.charactereditor.spritesheetorientationto: General orientation of the sprites as drawn on the spritesheet.
infotexts.charactereditor.spriteorientationtooltip: Orientation of the selected sprite as drawn on the spritesheet.
infotexts.charactereditor.generalorientationtoolti: Defines the "forward direction" of the sprite(s). Should be configured as the direction pointing outwards from the main limb. Incorrectly defined orientations may lead to limbs being rotated incorrectly, e.g. when the character aims or flips to face a different direction.
infotexts.missionname.killspinelingswarm2: Terminate a squadron of Spinelings and Viperlings
infotexts.missiondescription.killspinelingswarm2: A small swarm of both Spinelings and Viperlings has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] marks has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it.
infotexts.namecontainsinvisiblesymbols: Your client name ([name]) contained special symbols that aren't supported by the game, and they had to be removed. If you want to readjust the name before you join a server, please see the "name" textbox in the upper-left corner of the server browser menu and change it to your liking.
infotexts.editor.layer.headerlink.tooltip: The individual items in the layer are treated as a group: Selecting any of them selects them all.
infotexts.label: Label
infotexts.entitydescription.automateddockinghatch: Easy-to-set-up docking hatch with a delay, for submarines and shuttles. Connect navigation terminal's TOGGLE_DOCKING pin to SIGNAL_IN_1.
infotexts.label.automateddockinghatch.signal1: Connect TOGGLE_DOCKING to SIGNAL_IN_1 (from navigation terminal)
infotexts.label.automateddockinghatch.closehatch: If hatch is open, close it
infotexts.label.automateddockinghatch.openhatch: If hatch is closed, open it with a delay
infotexts.serversettingsautobantime.tooltip: The length of the automatic ban given to players who get vote-kicked or banned due to low karma.
infotexts.PasswordRemovedByClient: [clientname] removed password protection from the server.
infotexts.respawnexplanation: When enabled, players have the option to spawn during a round. When disabled, players can only respawn after the round ends, at the start of the next round.
infotexts.respawnshuttleexplanation: When enabled, players respawn in a shuttle. When disabled, they respawn directly inside the main submarine.
infotexts.losmodetransparent.tooltip: You see a dim view of the environment through walls (excluding anything dynamic like items or characters).
infotexts.losmodeopaque.tooltip: Walls block the view entirely, making obstructed areas of the screen solid black.
infotexts.missiondescription.lostcargo: A cargo transport vessel carrying crucial supplies was en route from [location1] to [location2] when it sent out a distress call before going silent. Find and retrieve the cargo crates, and deliver them.
infotexts.missionsuccess.lostcargo: The cargo has been successfully retrieved.
infotexts.missionmessage.lostcargo.allretrieved: The cargo crates containing crucial supplies have been retrieved. Bring the crates with their contents to [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvagewreckcargo: “A cargo transport vessel carrying crucial supplies was en route to a neighboring outpost when it sent out a distress call before going silent. We don't have another batch of cargo ready to be sent, so we need a reliable crew to retrieve it. Find, retrieve and deliver the cargo crates.”
infotexts.missionmessage.lostcargo.partiallyretrie: Some of the lost cargo is now on board the sub, but there is still more to retrieve.
infotexts.missionmessage.lostcargo.targetfound: The lost cargo has been found—now it needs to be brought to the submarine.
infotexts.missiondescription.lostartifact: A submarine transporting an alien artifact toward [location2] has been lost. Find and retrieve the artifact, and deliver it.
infotexts.missionsuccess.lostartifact: The artifact has been successfully retrieved.
infotexts.missionmessage0.lostartifact: The alien artifact has been retrieved. Bring it to [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvagewreckartif: “A submarine transporting an alien artifact has gone radio silent, presumably due to the artifact's strange effects. Find and retrieve the artifact, and deliver it—for science!”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_salvageclown: “Hey, you, person! Have you heard of the great tragedy of Honk-No-More? Yeah, me neither. But unless you can salvage some of our cargo from a nearby wreck, we might all come to hear of it soon. We really need those supplies.”
infotexts.missiondescription.cargowreckthalamus1: A cargo transport vessel went missing many months ago while transporting valuable materials from [location1] to [location2]. The vessel was presumed taken by the Abyss, but now its emergency beacon seems to have been activated near [location2]. Find out what happened to the vessel and retrieve the cargo.
infotexts.missionsuccess.cargowreckthalamus1: The cargo has been successfully retrieved. The scientists at [location2] might be eager to know the details of the encounter.
infotexts.missionmessage0.cargowreckthalamus1: The cargo has been retrieved. The missing vessel appeared to have been overtaken by some sort of parasitic growth, causing it to attack your submarine. Return the cargo and report the incident to [location2].
infotexts.missiondescription.clearthalamus1: A submarine traveling from [location1] to [location2] reported ballast flora growing in their ballast tank. Your employer suspects it has wrecked the submarine and grown into a thalamus. Your task is to eliminate it.
infotexts.missionfailure.clearthalamus1: Failed to destroy the thalamus' brain.
infotexts.missionmessage0.clearthalamus1: The brain of the thalamus has been destroyed. Report your success at [location2] to claim your reward.
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_wreckthalamus.c1: “Months ago, a submarine traveling to a neighbouring outpost reported ballast flora growing in their ballast tank. Lacking the knowledge to deal with the situation, the inexperienced crew succumbed to the ballast flora, and it was assumed that was the end. However, new reports from the area suggest it may have turned into a thalamus. Your task is to eliminate it.”
infotexts.dialogarrestfirstwarning: I'm warning you: Drop the stolen items now!
Freeze! Hands in the air! Give me the stolen property, right now!
Stop right there! Hand over the stolen items immediately!
infotexts.dialogarrestlastwarning: This is your last warning! Surrender now or deal with the consequences!
This is your last warning! Stop right there!
infotexts.afflictiondescription.camaraderie: Gain bonus experience and physical damage resistance.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.stationengineer: Repair and welding speed is increased.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.salvagecrew: Swimming speed and physical damage resistance is increased.
infotexts.talentdescription.bonusxponmission: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP when completing a [missiontype] mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.stationengineerbuff: Also gain +[amount1]% [skill1] and +[amount2]% [skill2] while on a ‖color:gui.orange‖Beacon Station‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.salvagecrew: Also gain +[swimbonus]% ‖color:gui.orange‖Swimming Speed‖end‖ and +[resistanceamount]% ‖color:gui.orange‖Physical Damage Resistance‖end‖ while inside ‖color:gui.orange‖Wrecks‖end‖.
infotexts.serversettingsskilllosspercentageonimmed: How much extra a character's skills drop toward their job's default skill levels when they die and choose to respawn immediately.
infotexts.respawnquestionpromptnoloss: Do you want to respawn now, or wait for the next round to spawn?
infotexts.talentdescription.bootcamp: Gain an additional [xpamount]% experience, until you have [level] talent points.\nOnce you have [level] or more talent points, gain +[skillamount] [skilltype] instead.
infotexts.talentdescription.protectandserve: Gain [xpbonus]% bonus XP and [repbonus]% more reputation when completing a [missiontype] mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.camaraderienew: While no crew member has died during a mission, gain [extraexperience]% bonus XP and [resistanceamount]% ‖color:gui.orange‖Physical Damage Resistance‖end‖.
infotexts.talentdescription.junctionjunkie: Gain one-time rewards for repairing a certain number of ‖color:gui.orange‖electrical devices‖end‖:
infotexts.talentdescription.machinemaniac: Gain one-time rewards for repairing a certain number of ‖color:gui.orange‖mechanical devices‖end‖:
infotexts.talentdescription.nobodyimportantdies: Medical items you apply are +[amount]% more potent when applied to non-assistants. Treating assistants is [penalty]% less effective.
infotexts.talentdescription.healthinsurance: If your health drops below [amount]% during a mission, gain [money] CR.
infotexts.CantAccessEOSSettingsInMP: Epic Online Services settings cannot be changed when a multiplayer session is active.
infotexts.CannotJoinSteamServer.SteamNotInitialize: The provided address seems to be a Steam ID. Cannot join a Steam ID when not connected to Steam.
infotexts.EosInterface.Core.InitError.NativeDllLoa: Loading the native Epic Online Services DLL failed.
infotexts.sp.CircuitBox.Locked.name: Locked
infotexts.sp.CircuitBox.Locked.description: Locked circuit boxes can only be viewed and not interacted with.
infotexts.entitydescription.adrenalinegland: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.
infotexts.entitydescription.scrapcannon: A battery-powered makeshift weapon that fires metal shrapnel. Wildly inaccurate, but not too picky when it comes to ammo—most pieces of dense metals will do.
infotexts.entitydescription.flamer: An incendiary weapon that fires a stream of burning welding fuel. Particularly effective with incendium fuel tanks.
infotexts.entitydescription.defendableposition: Used by AI on beacon stations to defend entrances. Hidden in-game.
infotexts.deathprompt.permadeathnotification: Your character has been permanently lost to Europa.
infotexts.deathprompt.takeoverbotexplanation: You can buy a new character from the HR manager in a non-hostile outpost, or take over one of the bots now (if available).
infotexts.deathprompt.nobotsavailable: There are no bots available to take control of.
infotexts.lobby.permadeathinfo: Your previous character is dead, so you can only join as a spectator for now.
infotexts.lobby.permadeathoptionsexplanation: You can buy a new character in-game from the HR manager in a non-hostile outpost, or take over any available bot crewmember if the server settings allow it.
infotexts.roundrunningpermadeath: A round is already running, but you can join as a spectator. Wait for a shuttle or a new round to spawn, or take over a new character if the previous one is dead.
infotexts.respawnmode.permadeath.tooltip: Characters die permanently. If your character dies, you need to find another one. Respawn either as a bot on your crew, or buy a new character at the next outpost.
infotexts.respawnmode.midround.tooltip: Allows respawning in the middle of a mission, either on the respawn shuttle (if enabled) or on the submarine (when respawn shuttle is disabled).
infotexts.respawnmode.betweenrounds.tooltip: Respawning is only allowed after finishing a level, e.g. when you reach an outpost.
infotexts.allowbottakeover.tooltip: Are players allowed to take control of existing bots when they die, or do they always need to purchase a new character?
infotexts.hireandtakecontrol: Hire and take control of the character.
infotexts.hireandtakecontroldisabled: You need permission to manage the crew's bank account money in order to hire and take control of a new character.
infotexts.ServerSettingsAllowDragAndDropGive: Allow players to give items by dragging and dropping
infotexts.serversettingsnewcampaigndefaultsalaryto: Default salary when starting a new campaign.
infotexts.resetsalaries.warning: Are you sure you want to reset all online players' salaries to the default value?
infotexts.resetsalaries.tooltip: Reset all online players' salaries to the default value.
infotexts.ironmanmode.tooltip: In ironman mode, death doesn't just affect the character; when a character dies, the player is removed from the game too. Dead players are only able to spectate.
infotexts.deathprompt.ironmanexplanation: And not just your character—YOU, the player, are done for the remainder of this campaign. Due to ironman rules, you can only spectate.
infotexts.lobby.ironmaninfo: You have died in this campaign. Ironman rules are enabled, so you can only spectate until a new campaign is started.
infotexts.roundrunningironman: A round is currently running. You can rejoin or respawn in the next friendly outpost, unless you've already died once in this campaign.
infotexts.dialogarrest.firstwarning: I'm warning you: Drop the stolen items now!
Freeze! Hands in the air! Give me the stolen property, right now!
Stop right there! Hand over the stolen items immediately!
infotexts.dialogarrest.lastwarning: This is your last warning! Surrender now, or deal with the consequences!
This is your last warning! Stop right there!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.criminal: Hey, you! I was told you might have something that doesn't belong to you. Let's see what you've got...
Hey, I know you! I need to check your pockets. Stop right there!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.arrest.criminal: I knew you were a thief! You're under arrest!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.nostolenitems.cri: Hmm... Okay, you can go...for now...
I could have sworn I saw you carrying something. You can go, for now...
Huh? Nothing here. Well, I'll check you again soon.
infotexts.sp.structure.removeiflinkedoutpostdoorin: When this setting is enabled and the entity is linked to a door at the edge of an outpost module, the entity will be removed if the door gets used in the outpost. Useful for, e.g., walls that you want to remove from a doorway that gets connected to another module.\n\nWhen this setting is disabled, it works the other way around: The entity is removed if the door is NOT in use. Useful for, e.g., ladders that are unnecessary if the door does not lead to another module.
infotexts.talentdescription.electrochemist: If you have not been attacked for [seconds] seconds, the next melee attack against you has [powerreduction]% less power, and your attacker is stunned for [stunseconds] seconds.
infotexts.entitydescription.aliengenerator: Generates electricity through alien power cells while also recharging them.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienterminal: Connected to alien devices. Sends signals if the required item is contained.
infotexts.entitydescription.toxinsvent: Emits toxins in alien ruins as long as toxins generator is active.
infotexts.tagdescription.geneticstorage: Places where genetic materials can be found, such as incubation bubbles, storage vats and sample displays in alien ruins.
infotexts.tagdescription.circuitrycontainer: Places where alien circuitry can be found, such as assembly device containers in alien ruins.
infotexts.missiontypedescription.eliminatetargets: Search and destroy targets, such as a thalamus or dangerous alien devices.
infotexts.talentdescription.warstories: At the end of each round, if you killed at least [minimumkills] enemies, creates a [book] in your inventory. Reading it gives [skill] skill to the reader; the skill gain is determined by the reader's current skill and the quality of the book.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammobox: Basic ammunition for the coilgun. Cheap, but lacks armor penetration.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoboxexplosiv: Explosive ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact, but contains less ammunition per box.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunammoboxpiercing: Armor-piercing ammunition for the coilgun. Effective against armored targets, but a pricey option for unarmored targets.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunshell: A basic, heavy shell for the railgun. Can be loaded with additional explosives that detonate upon impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.nuclearshell: A nuclear shell for the railgun. Causes a massive explosion.
infotexts.entitydescription.alienshell: A super-heavy shell for the railgun, made from an alien material. Can be loaded with additional explosives that detonate upon impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.railguncanistershell: A refillable burst-type munition for the railgun. While the metal pellets it contains are emitted and scattered at high velocity, the shell itself is preserved upon firing, making it cheap to use.
infotexts.entitydescription.pulselaserammoboxtrila: A box containing a special concoction of chemicals and rare materials. The lens used splits the laser in three, allowing it to hit multiple targets at once.
infotexts.entitydescription.dementonite: A higher-dimensional metamaterial. As dementonite has more than three spatial dimensions, the human mind cannot quite grasp it and would prefer not to even try.
infotexts.gamemodedescription.pvp: The players are split up into two teams, where they can compete with each other in various mission types.
infotexts.hint.geneticmaterial.useinstructions: You can use the genetic material by equipping a Gene Splicer and inserting the genetic material into it in the health interface. Once spliced onto a living subject, genetic material can still be removed.
infotexts.hint.geneticmaterial.onrefiningorcombini: Refining and combining genetic materials has a chance of tainting them, dependent on your medical skill. Combining genetic materials of different types always taints them.\n\nUsing tainted genes can have unexpected bad side effects, but refining a 100% pure material always removes any taint.
infotexts.entitydescription.genesplicer: A device used to splice alien genes into a human. Equip the splicer in the health interface and insert genetic materials into the splicer to activate the genes. Once spliced onto a living subject, genetic material can still be removed.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialhusk: Slows down the progression of husk infections by 30%. When the parasite is about to take control of the host, the progression is slowed by [value]% instead. High quality genes block transformation entirely.
infotexts.entitydescription.zealotrobes: A dark garment worn by esteemed members of the Church of Husk. Embedded with genetic technology and hormone injectors that give the wearer the enhanced regenerative capabilities of their symbiote.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialmudrapt: Causes the subject to grow a mudraptor-like beak. The beak decreases damage taken to the head by [value]% and increases the beak's damage by [value]%.
infotexts.entitydescription.geneticmaterialspineli: Causes the subject to grow spineling-like bony protrusions out of their back. Gene quality increases damage dealt with spikes by [value]%.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainscap2: Strikes fear into the hearts of your enemies.
infotexts.entitydescription.pirateclothes: A rugged outfit hand-crafted by the Jovian Separatists, designed to endure the harsh conditions of seabound life on Europa.
infotexts.missionfailure.pvpmission: Neither crew managed to destroy the enemy.
infotexts.VisibleLightLimitTooltip: If there are more lights than this visible on the screen, the least noticeable ones won't be drawn. A lower limit improves performance, but may cause lighting to flicker or look strange. Only affects shadow-casting lights.
infotexts.entitydescription.sulphuricacidsyringe: A mixture of strong acid and alien blood. Any living organism, provided they have blood circulation, absorbs the mixture into their bloodstream, causing heavy pain and limited mobility.
infotexts.entitydescription.europabrew: A double-edged chemical brew. While it activates the immune system to neutralize poisons, it also significantly weakens the target, making them more susceptible to all damage types, as well as husk infection.
infotexts.afflictiondescription.acidreaction: Affected by Europabrew. While it cures most poisons, it drastically weakens the target, making them more susceptible to damage and husk infections.
infotexts.entitydescription.repairpack: A makeshift multi-tool, capable of quickly correcting both mechanical and electrical problems.
infotexts.entitydescription.magneticsuspensioncrat: A vessel in which highly unstable items may be stored. While powered, materials such as volatile nitroglycerin will be kept from exploding.
infotexts.entitydescription.surveillancecenter: Usable device for observing and controlling cameras.
infotexts.entitydescription.multiplexercomponent: A multiplexer, or mux, component. The input data can be forwarded from one selected input out of multiple input connections.
infotexts.entitydescription.demultiplexercomponent: A demultiplexer, or demux, component. The input data can be forwarded to one selected output out of multiple output connections.
infotexts.sp.multiplexercomponent.SelectedInput.de: The input number the device is reading incoming signals from.
infotexts.sp.demultiplexercomponent.SelectedOutput: The output number the device is passing oncoming signals to.
infotexts.sp.wraparound.name: Wrap around
infotexts.sp.wraparound.description: Should the selected connection go back to the first when it moves past the last one?
infotexts.sp.SkipEmptyConnections.name: Skip empty connections
infotexts.sp.SkipEmptyConnections.description: Should empty connections (connections with no wires in them) be skipped over when moving the selection?
infotexts.entitydescription.surveillancecamera: Typically used in important rooms to provide the security crew with an overview of what is happening on the sub or outpost.
infotexts.serversettingsnewcampaigndefaultsalaryto: Default salary when starting a new campaign.
infotexts.resetsalaries.warning: Are you sure you want to reset all online players' salaries to the default value?
infotexts.resetsalaries.tooltip: Reset all online players' salaries to the default value.
infotexts.deletemodsconfirm: Are you sure you want to delete [amount] mod(s)?\nThis cannot be undone!
infotexts.subeditor.duplicatefilenameerror: Failed to save the file. The content package [packagename] contains a submarine file with the same name. Please choose another name.
infotexts.tagdescription.chaingunloader: Feeds ammunition boxes into a chaingun.
infotexts.gamemodesettings.markenemylocationtoolti: Use a marker to approximate the enemy submarine location.
infotexts.gamemodesettings.stunresistancetooltip: How much applied stun effects are reduced for humans.
infotexts.gamemodesettings.outposttooltip: Which outpost to select for the mission. Only relevant if the selected mission takes place in an outpost (such as the outpost deathmatch mission).
infotexts.missiontypedescription.jailbreak: Rescue prisoners from an outpost's brig and bring them to the safety of your submarine.
infotexts.missiondescriptionneutral.outpostdeathma: The Europa Coalition and Jovian Separatists are fighting for the control of [location1].
infotexts.missiondescription1.outpostdeathmatch: The Jovian Separatists are trying to take over [location1]. It must not fall to the hands of the filthy rebels—eliminate them by any means necessary!\n\nThe first team to reach [winscore] kills wins. There will be periodical supply drops throughout the round.
infotexts.missiondescription2.outpostdeathmatch: The Europa Coalition is trying to take over [location1]. It must not fall to the hands of the vile fascists—eliminate them by any means necessary!\n\nThe first team to reach [winscore] kills wins. There will be periodical supply drops throughout the round.
infotexts.missionmessage0.outpostdeathmatch: The Coalition has crushed the Separatist crew!
infotexts.missionmessage1.outpostdeathmatch: The Separatists have crushed the Coalition crew!
infotexts.missionsuccess.outpostdeathmatch: [winner] has secured control of the outpost.
infotexts.missionfailure.outpostdeathmatch: Neither crew managed to secure control of the outpost.
infotexts.missionsuccess.kingofthehull_beaconstati: [winner] has secured control of the beacon station.
infotexts.missionfailure.kingofthehull_beaconstati: Neither crew managed to secure control of the beacon station.
infotexts.missiondescriptionneutral.kingofthehull_: The Europa Coalition and Jovian Separatists are fighting for the control of a beacon station between [location1] and [location2].
infotexts.missiondescription1.kingofthehull_beacon: The Jovian Separatists are trying to take over a beacon station between [location1] and [location2]. It must not fall to the hands of the filthy rebels—eliminate them by any means necessary!\n\nThe first team to stay in control of the station for [winscore] seconds wins.
infotexts.missiondescription2.kingofthehull_beacon: The Europa Coalition is trying to take over a beacon station between [location1] and [location2]. It must not fall to the hands of the vile fascists—eliminate them by any means necessary!\n\nThe first team to stay in control of the station for [winscore] seconds wins.
infotexts.missionmessage0.kingofthehull_beaconstat: The Coalition has secured control of the beacon station.
infotexts.missionmessage1.kingofthehull_beaconstat: The Separatists have secured control of the beacon station.
infotexts.missiontypedescription.salvageruin: Find and retrieve an artifact or some other valuable item from an alien ruin.
infotexts.missiontypedescription.salvagewreck: Find and retrieve sensitive or valuable cargo from a sunken submarine.
infotexts.missiontypedescription.salvagecave: Find and retrieve an alien artifact or some other valuable item from a cave.
infotexts.ServerSettingsWinScorePvPTooltip: The score required to win a PvP mission (only applicable if the mission has a scoring system, such as in the deathmatch missions).
infotexts.entitydescription.alienterminal2: Connected to alien doors and hatches. Sends signals if the required item is contained.
infotexts.sp.buttonterminal.deactivatedsignal.name: Deactivated Signal
infotexts.sp.buttonterminal.deactivatedsignal.desc: Signal constantly sent through all the connections when the terminal is deactivated (i.e., when there's no required item(s) inside it).
infotexts.sp.wire.width.name: Width
infotexts.entitydescription.guardianpodtrap: Trap variant of protective pod for Fractal Guardians
infotexts.eventtext.alienwriting.4_1: THE SINGER IS ALONE - THE DEVOTED LONGING FOR [UNTRANSLATABLE]?\nA BRIDGE TO BRING NIGH\nTHE GREAT SPHERE IS BUILT
infotexts.eventtext.alienwriting.5_1: WHICH CAME FIRST - YOH-WEY, THE DEVOTED, THE ONES FROM THE SKY\nTHIS ONE DOES NOT KNOW, BUT IS SURELY ONE OF THE LAST\nLEST THEY CAN QUENCH THE RADIANCE
infotexts.eventtext.alienwriting.6_1: THE RADIANCE OF THE GREAT SPHERE\nDID WE NOT UNDERSTAND OR DID WE NOT [UNTRANSLATABLE?]\nTHE BRIDGE CALLS IT FORTH
infotexts.hint.onobtaineditem.handgrenade: You've obtained a grenade. You can prematurely cook it by pressing [usekey]. Once the safety has been disengaged there's no turning back!
infotexts.tagdescription.chaingunloader: Feeds ammunition boxes into a chaingun.
infotexts.dialogarrest.lastwarning: This is the last warning! Surrender now or deal with the consequences!
This is the last warning! Stop right there!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.criminal: Hey, you! I was told you might have something that doesn't belong to you. Let's see what you've got...
Hey, I know you! I need to check your pockets. Stop right there!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.arrest.criminal: I knew you were a thief! You're under arrest!
infotexts.dialogcheckstolenitems.nostolenitems.cri: Hmm, okay. You can go, for now...
I could have sworn I saw you carrying something. You can go, for now...
Huh? Nothing here. Well, I'll check you again soon.
infotexts.hulllinkinfo: Linked hulls will show as one room on status monitors.
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins1.c1: “Hey, aren't you from that crew that's been aiding us with our research?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins1.o1: “Yes, we've done some ruin missions if that's what you're asking.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins1.o1.c1: “I just want to say we're all stoked about the data you've provided us! With your help, we've made significant progress in understanding who or what the Ancients were.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins1.o1.o1.c1: “It's become evident that they had some kind of an obsession with Jupiter, or perhaps a deity associated with Jupiter. Not surprising, of course; the tidal flexing caused by the gas giant is where Europa gets its energy from, much like the Earth gets its energy from the Sun, which too was worshiped by ancient humans.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins1.o1.o1.o1.c1: “What is curious though is how concretely this Jupiter-worship seems to have manifested in their society. It almost seems like most of their scientific pursuits revolved around 'bridging the gap' to the deity in some sense.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins1.o1.o1.o1.o1: “What do you mean by 'bridging the gap'?”

“That's an open question still. The gravity spheres, which you've probably come across during your ruin expeditions, appear to be linked to it somehow: It could be they saw those intense gravity fields as idols of Jupiter or as a way to bring a part of their god's realm to Europa. Which brings me to another open question.”
“The question of the unusual gravity around the Eye of Europa?”

“I meant the question of why they seemed to have never left Europa. I mean, we’re still not convinced they even originated on Europa, but we’ve found no indication of them possessing any technology for space flight. And they had tech that can manipulate gravity—if we had that kind of power, we'd be colonizing other star systems in no time! Their religious views on Jupiter could have something to do with it though. Maybe they were too fixated on the gas giant and the Jovian system to even consider there was something more out there?”

“Although, that doesn't explain why they wouldn't have set out to Jupiter itself. Nor why they disappeared or what it has to do with the Eye of Europa. Again, we're talking about a gravity-manipulating civilization here, which somehow went extinct, and higher-than-normal gravity and Jovian radiation in an area that civilization used to inhabit. There must be a connection here, but I feel like we're still missing too many pieces of the puzzle to see it.”

“The thing is, we need more information. Ruin scans or artifacts—any little bit of extra data we can get helps! And, hypothetically speaking, if someone were to travel to the center of the Eye, and make it back alive, it could be the key to figuring it all out.”
“We seem to be heading that way...”

“Oh, no, I'm not suggesting you travel down there! None of the research vessels or drones we've sent there have ever come back, and I don't want to be the one who gave you the idea of embarking on such a suicide mission. But, just thinking out loud here, I do suspect we might be able to find some answers there.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.c1: “Hello there, submariner! It's been a while.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o2.c1: “Well, last time we spoke, we had this in-depth discussion about the Ancients and the ruins they left behind.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o2.o1: “Forgive me. I suppose exploring those ruins doesn't come without a cost. I'm starting to remember now.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.c2: “You have most certainly explored the ruins plenty and we're very thankful for that. My associates and I have made enormous progress unveiling the mysteries of these ancient structures.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.c1: “Do tell, have you managed to decipher any of the writings on the ruins' walls yet?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.o1.c1: “So you've found a translator. My fellow researcher has made some interpretation work with the help of one of those things. How has it felt, translating the writings?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.o1.o1: “Found them very intriguing yet frustratingly cryptic at times. It's baffling how you don't need to read them per se, you just...understand. Has your associate made any findings?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.c2: “Do tell, have you managed to decipher any of the writings on the ruins' walls yet?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.o2.c1: “It certainly is with this tablet, a translator of sorts. It seems you have one in your possession at this very moment—do give it a try next time you're visiting the ruins. My fellow researcher has already made some interpretation work with the help of one of those things.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.o2.c2: “It certainly is with this tablet, a translator of sorts. My fellow researcher has already made some interpretation work with the help of one of those things.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.o2.o2: “I'll keep my eyes open. Has your associate made any findings?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.c3: “They have, and those findings have been anything but trivial. There are these recurring terms used in the writings that have really caught our attention; “THE SINGER” for instance, must be a reference to the deity I mentioned before. But why they are called that, we are not sure.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3: “One of the writings mentioned 'YOH-WEY.' Could that also be the deity?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o3.c3: “'YOH-WEY'? Well, it most certainly could. I just haven't heard anyone mention that name before.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.c4: “'THE BRIDGE' most likely refers to some kind of passage, perhaps a unique one. And it's often mentioned with 'THE GREAT SPHERE.' Considering how preoccupied the Ancients were with anything related to Jupiter, 'THE GREAT SPHERE' could very well be just that.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o5: “So a passage to Jupiter? But what sort of passage?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins2.o5.c1: “Just keep exploring the ruins, submariner. I have a feeling we're very close to finding out.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.announcemen: An announcement comes over the PA. “Calling the crew of the vessel that just docked. Please come to the research module. We have something to show you.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c1: “Hey, if it isn't one of our favorite submariners! I don't know if you've heard, but it seems we might be on the brink of a breakthrough with the data from your recent missions.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.o1.c1: “I feel we're very close to figuring out the principles behind the n-dimensional metamaterials the Ancients used to curve space. That is to say, we’re close to figuring out how the gravity spheres work and what they do.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.o1.o1: “I can already tell you what they do: They suck you in and crush you.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.o1.o1.c1: “Well, yes, but there’s more to it. We’ve discovered a mechanism in the spheres that can generate fields with negative energy density, which, according to our calculations, would keep the sphere stable even if the curvature at the center was much more extreme.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.o1.o1.o1.c1: “The spheres have the capability to bend space-time much more drastically than what you’ve seen during your ruin expeditions. To the point where we believe, and, uhh, this is just speculation, to the point where it could form something akin to a bridge to another point in space-time. Not unlike what they used to call a 'wormhole' in old fictional tales on Earth.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.o1.o1.o1.o1: “We are just about to find out whether our speculations are correct. This thing over here is a sort of imitation of a gravity sphere, and we’ve just set everything up for the first test run.”
“If you’re interested, feel free to stay and watch! The rest of your crew is also welcome to join. Let me know when you're all here.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.areyouready: “Is this everyone who wants to see the experiment? Should we begin?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c2: The researchers start fiddling with the control panels and research stations. They seem to be going through a checklist of some sort. “Supercapacitors fully charged,” “containment field stable at -0.5 megajoules per cubic meter,” “curvature 24 degrees and increasing.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c3: “Curvature increasing rapidly. Can’t get an accurate reading. Do we abort?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c5: Gravity feels off. Space feels off. But your attention is now fixated on the swirling thing at the center of the room. You feel as if something was coming out of it. You don’t see anything, but it’s as if vines of thoughts were squirming out of the sphere, gently wrapping themselves around your brain like a soft caress.
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c6: A thought forms in your mind. “This bridge was not built by us. How are you here?”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c7: As you’re trying to form a response of some sort inside your head, another thought washes in. “You must be the Descendants. We did not believe you would make it this far. Perhaps there is hope for both of us.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c8: Again, you try to think of a response, your thoughts drifting to the Jovian radiation and the Eye of Europa. “It was a grave mistake, and now we are both paying the price. Perhaps you can undo it.”
infotexts.EventText.explorealienruins3.c9: As the swirl at the center of the room starts to grow smaller and flicker, a jumble of thoughts engulfs your mind. “This bridge won’t last. Perhaps the great bridge will not last. It will destroy you. Find us. YOH-WEY. The great storm. Only home. Eye.”
infotexts.entitydescription.flakcannonammoboxgravi: A heavy box of ammo for the flak cannon, loaded with alien dementonite-based gravity sphere technology.
infotexts.entitydescription.gravityshell: For firing from a railgun. Alien dementonite-based gravity sphere technology pulls anything nearby towards the impact.
infotexts.entitydescription.mindsense: A dementonite-based consumable concoction that allows you to sense other living beings through walls. The effect of the chemical is still poorly understood, but it certainly has to do with the odd space-altering properties of dementonite.
infotexts.entitydescription.mindwipe: Allows you to reset your talent points. Consecutive use will result in increasingly bad memory loss, returning less and less of your initial experience.
infotexts.talentresetprompt: You are eligible to reset your talent tree and get a refund of your talent points. Do you want to reset your talents?
infotexts.afflictiondescription.mindsense: If the abyss gazes long enough into you, you will gaze back into it…
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.c1: You notice a man tied down to the bed in the medical bay, his bloodshot eyes darting wildly across the room.
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o2: “Just another day on Europa, am I right?”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.c2: “That’s Harald, a submariner just like you. His crewmates brought him in—said he’d been hallucinating fires and monsters. Seemed like just another case of psychosis, so I gave him haloperidol. It worked for some minutes, but clearly it didn’t last. I tried the one thing and now I’m all out of ideas, so I just tied him down until someone figures something out. Wait, did you hear that?”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o3.c1: “It sounded like my upstairs neighbor was chanting again… Something like YOH-WEY, YOH-WEY. Maybe he joined some kind of cult. You didn’t hear anything? There it is again…”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o3.o2: “Ah, now that you say it, I think I hear it too…”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.c3: You notice Harald's right hand has been in the pocket of his coverall the entire time, fiddling with something. Something in your mind forces you to look at it. You manage to see through the coverall, not with your eyes but simply your consciousness. You know it’s there and it compels you to touch it.
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o4.c1: You reach into the submariner’s pocket and force his hand out. He grins at you while you desperately try to pry the item from his thin fingers. Finally, using your other hand as well, you manage to lever open his palm and gain possession of the object.
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o4.c1.o1.c1: You recognize it. It’s a piece of dementonite, and your eyes struggle to make sense of it, inflicting you with a massive headache. Unlike other dementonite you’ve encountered, however, this one wants to sing to you. It wants us to become whole, so we may depart from our daily suffering, from our daily needs, and simply be.
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o4.o1.o1.o1.c1: As your mind drifts and finds itself floating, first across Europa, then across some vast and ancient structures beyond your understanding, you see an eye.\nYour destination is clear as you lose yourself in the visage of this eye; it dances and nudges. You are ready to join the dance. You’d like to move your legs but notice you don’t have legs, nor a body.
The moment of bliss is ripped and torn away in an instant, as you see the eye turn back to a piece of dementonite, flung across the room, and the worried face of the doctor staring right at you.\n\n“We should be glad I accidentally stabbed myself with a syringe of haloperidol, or we would have all lost our minds in this little room here…”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o4.c1.o1.o2.c1: You toss the piece as far away as possible. In an instant, your mind clears, and also the doctor and the submariner are noticeably less manic.
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.c4: After a brief pause, you regain all your senses. The doctor's voice sounds strangely far away but grows louder and louder. \n\n“I guess that piece of rock is what’s been causing Harald's woes—and it almost got to us too. At a sufficient distance, the effect appears to wear off rapidly… Have you seen anything like this before?”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o6: “Dementonite I have seen, yes, but these effects…no.”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.o7: “It seemed pretty neat at first. This could make serious money in nightclubs.”
infotexts.EventText.mindsunraveled.c5: “Keeping it here is irresponsible—we need to get this to some scientists and contain it. In the meantime, you two get out of the medical bay at once. We don’t want any more incidents. Oh, and take this spare syringe of haloperidol in case you start seeing things again.”
infotexts.permadeath.rename.description: You can only rename a newly taken over character once in permadeath mode.
infotexts.ServerSettings.ReplaceCostPercentage.too: Modifies the cost of respawning as a new character at the HR manager, in case a player has been (permanently) killed. If set to zero, new characters are free and no extra permissions are needed to buy them.
infotexts.itemtransferwarning: The selected submarine might not have enough items like fuel, oxygen tanks, ammunition, etc. to start with. Are you sure you want to switch to the submarine without transferring the items on your current submarine with you?
infotexts.entitydescription.skillbook_warstories: A collection of stories about encounters with alien life on Europa, narrated in an exceedingly gruesome manner. Gives weapon skill to the reader, based on the book's quality and the reader's current weapon skill.
infotexts.dialog.exosuit.outoffuel: I'm out of fuel. Cannot move.
Could someone please fetch me some fuel for this suit? I can't move!
infotexts.entitydescription.captainseparatistsunif: Brown never goes out of Separatist fashion.
Nobody inspires more confidence in their troops than a seasoned veteran.
For when you need to fight for freedom and look the part.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainsseparatistcap1: Strikes fear into the hearts of the Coalition.
infotexts.entitydescription.captainsseparatistcap2: A classic hat choice for the local militant warlord.
infotexts.entitydescription.engineerseparatistsuni: Perhaps the camouflage will simply hide you from the radiation.
The bright yellow sleeves make it look like you know what you're doing.
infotexts.entitydescription.mechanicseparatistsuni: Joining the Jovian Separatists doesn’t mean you get some fancy uniform, just a practical one.
Sturdy jeans and steel toe cap shoes is all the protection you need.
infotexts.entitydescription.separatistcommoner3: A rugged outfit hand-crafted by the Jovian Separatists, designed to endure the harsh conditions of seabound life on Europa. This specific outfit has been improved with light armor plating.
infotexts.equipped.required.tooltip: The user must be wearing or holding an item with one of the listed identifiers or tags to interact with this component.
infotexts.picked.required.tooltip: The user must have an item with one of the listed identifiers or tags anywhere in their inventory to interact with this component. You can use ID card tags defined in the submarine's spawn points to restrict interaction to specific jobs.
infotexts.entitydescription.weapondrop: A vessel in which combat items may be found.
infotexts.entitydescription.weapondropspecial: A vessel in which rare combat items may be found.
infotexts.entitydescription.boardingpod: A single-use weapon used for launching troops inside enemy vessels. Put your least favorite assistant inside, load the pod into a depth charge loader, fire at the enemy and hope for the best!
infotexts.TeamSelectionMode.tooltip: The method by which teams are formed in PvP mode.
infotexts.TeamSelectionMode.PlayerPreference.toolt: Players can choose a preferred team or no preference, and the game will try to create balanced teams based on those preferences.
infotexts.TeamSelectionMode.PlayerChoice.tooltip: Players can choose a team (or to spectate instead), but auto-balancing may limit the team choice.
infotexts.AutoBalanceThreshold.tooltip: This is the maximum allowed difference in team size. Auto-balancing will trigger if the threshold is crossed.
infotexts.AutoBalance.CountdownStarted: The [teamname] team has [numberplayers] players too many. Auto-balancing in [numberseconds] seconds...
infotexts.PvP.TeamDisabledBecauseBalance: Cannot join this team now because the team's size would cross the team balance threshold.
infotexts.PvP.WithoutTeamWillBeRandomlyAssigned: Players who have not chosen a team (or to spectate) will now be assigned to random teams.
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutposthuskm: Contact with [location1] was recently lost. It's suspected that the outpost is under invasion by hostile fauna. Get rid of all the creatures found inside the outpost.
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutposthuskmonst: The creatures inside the outpost have been successfully eliminated.
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutposthuskmons: The creatures inside the outpost have been successfully eliminated. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.entitydescription.railgunharpoon: A massive harpoon that can be fired from a railgun to reel in targets such as submarines and large monsters.
infotexts.entitydescription.coilgunharpoonbox: Harpoons that can be fired from a coilgun to reel in targets such as submarines and monsters.
infotexts.sp.turret.FriendlyTeam.name: Friendly Team
infotexts.sp.turret.FriendlyTeam.description: Team that the turret considers friendly. If set to None, the team the submarine/outpost belongs to is considered the friendly team.
infotexts.label.noentryseparatists: Automatic defense system active—Separatists will be shot!
infotexts.label.noentrycoalition: Automatic defense system active—Coalition members will be shot!
infotexts.submarine.description.pvp_raatecolony: A large, symmetrical colony prepared for a clash between the factions with defensive turrets, surveillance cameras and barricades.
infotexts.submarine.description.PvP_KattenbergOutp: An action-packed medium-sized outpost, where the two factions are duking it out to see who can control the middle areas on top of the stairs.
infotexts.entitydescription.timeddetonator: A version of the detonator with an adjustable timer, which detonates any contained explosive (by default) 8 seconds after being armed.
infotexts.eventtext.malfunctioningdefensebot.c1: You find someone has left a defense bot in the storage. Although it looks rather scratched and defective, there's a chance a skilled mechanic could get it back up and running.
infotexts.eventtext.malfunctioningdefensebot.o1.c1: Well, it seems to be rebooting, so perhaps it’s functional! However, something appears to be amiss… The bot's armaments are slowly turning toward you.
Attempt to reroute the power and hack into the bot's mainframe.
Success! The defense bot's lights are now green, which might mean you have connected some wire to the green LEDs, or it might mean it no longer considers you hostile.
Dagnabbit! You seem to have powered the bot's gun servos, considering the gun is turning a whole lot faster now. Better find cover.
Could there be a crawler right behind you? Better check.
infotexts.eventtext.malfunctioningdefensebot.o1.c2: Give it a kick, for good measure.
infotexts.backuptooltip: Return to a save from an earlier point in the campaign. Loading an older save won't overwrite your current one until you save the game again.
infotexts.ironmanmodebackupdisclaimer: Backups are unavailable when ironman mode is enabled.
infotexts.disembarkpointsnotvalid: Game cannot be started because too many perks have been selected.
infotexts.serversettingsdisembarkpointstooltip: The perk point allowance in PvP, mission and sandbox modes that can be used to unlock perks such as talent points, upgrades and extra gear.
infotexts.trystartgameerror.perksexceedallowance: Too many perks have been selected.
infotexts.trystartgameerror.submarinenotfound: Selected submarine or shuttle not found.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.talentpoints: Crew members start with 3 talent points
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.talentpointsadv: Crew members start with 5 talent points
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.talentpointseli: Crew members start with 8 talent points
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.airlockbasic: The airlock contains basic diving tools, such as an underwater scooter, plasma cutters and sonar beacons.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.mobilitypack: Adds underwater scooters, combat diving suits and harpoon guns to the submarine.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.boardingkits: Adds boarding tools, such as crowbars, slipsuits and boarding pods, to the submarine.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.armorysmall: The armory contains basic weapons, such as diving knives, revolvers and harpoon guns.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.armoryclosequar: The armory contains close quarters weapons, such as shotguns, machine pistols and SMGs.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.armorylongrange: Expands the armory with long-range weaponry, such as rifles and an assault rifle.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.armorypeacekeep: Adds stun guns and stun grenades to the armory.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.medbayfirstaid: The medbay contains basic health items, such as bandages, saline and opium.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.medbaylifesaver: Expands the medbay with better medicines, such as morphine, blood packs and naloxone.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.medbaycombatdru: Adds various combat-enhancing drugs to the medbay.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.engineeringship: The engineering quarters contain basic ship repair tools.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.engineeringrawm: The engineering quarters cabinets are stocked with raw crafting materials.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.engineeringsabo: The engineering quarters cabinets have UEX, detonators and wires.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.engineeringince: The engineering quarters contains incendium tanks and flamers.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.engineeringexos: The engineering quarters has one exosuit.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.hullupgradestee: Upgrades the submarine's hull to be more damage and crushdepth resistant.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.hullupgradetaal: Upgrades the submarine's hull to be more damage and crushdepth resistant.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.hullupgradephys: Upgrades the submarine's hull to be more damage and crushdepth resistant.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.slotcoilgunturr: Installs a coilgun turret in a hardpoint slot.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.slotchainguntur: Installs a chaingun turret in a hardpoint slot.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.slotpulselaser: Installs a pulse laser turret in a hardpoint slot.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.largeslotflakca: Installs a flak cannon in a large hardpoint slot.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.largeslotdouble: Installs a double coilgun in a large hardpoint slot.
infotexts.disembarkperkdescription.largeslotrailgu: Installs a railgun in a large hardpoint slot.
infotexts.startgamewarning: Some of the selected perks are not suitable for the selected submarine(s). You can abort the game start to change your selection.
infotexts.startggamewarningprogress: Game will be started in [seconds] seconds
infotexts.noperksavailable: Perks are not available in the currently selected mission.
infotexts.talentdescription.junctionjunkie.30: - ‖color:gui.orange‖[requirement]‖end‖: Upgrades the submarine's ‖color:gui.orange‖junction boxes‖end‖ to level [level].
infotexts.submarine.description.berilia: Berilia is one of the biggest cargo ships on Europa. Its two engines and four ballasts require a copious amount of power to operate, and keeping the machinery in good working condition is a handful for even a moderately large crew.
infotexts.entitydescription.abyssdivingsuit: A heavy suit designed for deep sea exploration. Protects against damage and high pressure all the way down to 6,600 meters, but at a cost of reduced movement speed.
infotexts.talentresetpromptwarning: Since you have already reset your talents before, your talent points will be reduced by [count].
infotexts.sp.turret.AllowAutoOperateWithWiring.des: Can the Auto Operate functionality be enabled using signals to the turret?
infotexts.NoSuitableBrainRoomsWarning: Cannot find a suitable room for the Thalamus brain. Using a random room. The wreck should be fixed so that there's at least one room where the following conditions are met: No linked hulls, no open gaps in the floor or to outside the sub, and no other Thalamus items present in the hull.
infotexts.EventText.callhusks.c1: I could call more husks if needed.
infotexts.EventText.callhusks.c2: I think there's still some power left in the husk caller, I could probably use it one more time if needed…
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.targetspecies.name: Target Species
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.targetspecies.descriptio: Does the sensor react only to certain species (species name, group or tag)? Doesn't have an effect, if the Target Type is incorrect.
infotexts.missiondifficultyxpbonustooltip: This mission gives +[bonus]% XP based on difficulty.
infotexts.missionmessage1.scanruin: Second part of the ruin successfully scanned. One more to go!
infotexts.missionmessage0.scanruin: First part of the ruin successfully scanned.
infotexts.EventText.associate.c1: “Hey you, yes you! You seem like a capable submariner.”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.c1: “Can I bother you for a moment? You see, we’re running out of time and could really use a helping hand.”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1: “Who is 'we'? What’s in it for me?”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1.c1: “Meaning me and my associates, namely Dr. Dawson and his research team. It seems awfully certain the future of mankind depends on this research of theirs and I’d say that alone is reason enough to let me finish.”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1.o2: “Right, didn't quite hear what's in it for me?”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1.o2.c1: “Naturally, you'll be well compensated for your efforts. You can also keep most of the loot to yourself, and rest assured, there is plenty.”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1.o1.c1: “Our request concerns these ancient ruins and artifacts that you will undoubtedly encounter on your travels. The research team is in desperate need of some new data, but getting anywhere near the resources has proved to be... hazardous, to say the least. We've lost some good people on earlier expeditions and can't afford to lose one more. I'm asking you to grab any missions related to these ancient ruins or artifacts, a successful gig will benefit us one way or the other.”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1.o1.o1: “Doesn't sound like an easy task, let alone safe.”
infotexts.EventText.associate.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: “Never said it was, but this is our best bet.”
infotexts.RespawnModeMismatch: The currently selected respawn mode ([currentrespawnmode]) does not match the respawn mode of the save file ([savedrespawnmode]).\n\nDo you want to go back to review the respawn mode settings, or load the game anyway with the new settings?
infotexts.targetdisplay.tooltip: Which display the game should be shown on.
infotexts.refreshaudiodevicestooltip: Refreshes the audio devices. If you swap, plug or unplug any audio devices, you may need to press this to detect that change manually.
infotexts.traitor.blamebutton.tooltip: At the end of the round, if the majority of players have correctly suspected the traitor, the traitor fails their objective and will not receive any rewards (such as getting to steal experience points or portions of the mission reward).
infotexts.traitor.blamebutton.dialog: I think [name] might be trying to sabotage our mission…
I have a feeling [name] is a traitor…
[name] is acting kinda sus, right crew? Right…?
What are you up to, [name]? Something is off…
[name], you traitorous scum. I do not trust you!
What shady business have you gotten yourself into, [name]?
What nefarious plan is occupying you, [name]?
[name] is not working toward our mission objective. Do they have some hidden agenda?
infotexts.traitor.blameresult: The crew suspected [name] as a traitor!
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.correct.objectivesuc: The crew's suspicions were correct. Since the traitor was exposed, they will not receive any rewards from whoever assigned them the traitorous task, even though they successfully completed it.
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.correct.objectivefai: The crew's suspicions were correct. Luckily, the traitor failed to complete their task.
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.failure: The crew's suspicions turned out to be incorrect, and the traitor may still be at large.
infotexts.traitor.blameresult.failure.penalty: The crew has received a fine of [money] credits for wasting the official's time with the false accusations.
infotexts.traitortimebomb.stage1: By equipping the bomb and a screwdriver, one could remove a panel.
infotexts.traitortimebomb.stage2: Wires are exposed. A skilled weapon-user could defuse this by equipping the bomb and a sharp tool like a knife.
infotexts.traitortimebomb.stage3: It looks like a bomb with a text display and some wires strapped to it. It has been defused.
infotexts.traitor.dangerlevelsetting.tooltip: How dangerous the traitor objectives can be. If, for example, you're playing the campaign mode and don't want players to get assigned traitor objectives that would seriously harm the crew's progress, you might want to choose a low danger level.
infotexts.traitor.dangerlevel.2.description: Might result in injuries and/or damage to the submarine.
infotexts.traitor.dangerlevel.3.description: High chance of causing injuries or even casualties.
infotexts.traitor.probability.tooltip: The probability of some players getting assigned traitor objectives during a round.
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.c1: You are angry. Enraged, even. The constant stress of being confined to your metal coffin is taking its toll on you, and you know it. You have to take out that anger somewhere on something… The beacon station you're supposed to visit might have a nuclear reactor that could be overloaded, causing a huge explosion and radiation to harm those Jove-forsaken crawlers and mudraptors for a long time to come. Your hand stops shaking for the first time in days. You know now: It is what you have to do.
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.objective1: Cause a nuclear meltdown at the beacon station's nuclear reactor.
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.objective2: The beacon station has been burnt to a crisp!
infotexts.EventText.bakingstation.objective3: No beacon station meltdown has been observed.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.c1: Right before you entered the submarine through the station's airlock, you found a shady-looking figure standing in the shadows. He gave you a crooked smile, and said: “Your wallet looks awfully light after the shore leave, eh? Want to do something about that? You see, the cargo you're transporting… The recipients are very desperate for that cargo. They pay good money. Now, if that cargo arrives, they're no longer desperate, no longer paying good money. See where I am going with this? If some cargo were to go missing, it might profit both of us.”\n\nNow you're still wondering whether or not to take the money. It's dirty, but marks are marks.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective1: Ensure at least half of the cargo that's part of the transport mission doesn't make it to the destination.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective2: The cargo is no longer on the submarine. Looks like you're getting paid while your crew is getting played.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective3: To the dismay of your crew and the receiving party, the cargo was nowhere to be found.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective4: When the time came to unload the cargo, your crew found out most of the items were missing. The client is not pleased.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective5: You've failed to get rid of enough cargo.
infotexts.EventText.cargotheft.objective6: The cargo was found on board the submarine, despite a risk of betrayal.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.c1: A burly figure leans in the doorframe, blocking your way. You're already late, having just heard the call to get back to your submarine ASAP—what could he possibly want? He has a scowl on his face, but does not seem to be threatening you.\n\n“Hear me out,” he starts. “I oversee mining operations around here, and to put it frankly, your mining mission is going to cut into my profits. Not your problem, you could say, but I say: business opportunity. Cause a few malfunctions in your plasma cutters, and I'll see you're paid more than your mission's cut would be.”
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective1: Disrupt the mining efforts by swapping oxygen tanks in 50% of the plasma cutters for welding fuel tanks.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.c2: This should scare the crew off from future mining operations, which will make your employer happy.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective2: The plasma cutters have been sabotaged. Fingers crossed that nobody actually dies.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective3: The sabotage has been carried out successfully.
infotexts.EventText.miningsabotage.objective4: The sabotage did not meet the requirements.
infotexts.traitorobjective.miningsabotage.swapobje: Swap welding fuel tanks into 50% of the plasma cutters
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture.c1: In the latest edition of The Europan magazine, you read about a hot new craze: pet mudraptors. How cool would it be if you could hatch and train a mudraptor from birth to be your loyal ally? Your captain wouldn't dare refuse your requests for a pay raise after that. And it just so happens that you might have a perfect chance to get yourself a fresh mudraptor egg!
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture.objective1: Obtain a mudraptor egg from the nest and bring it into the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.c1: In the latest edition of The Europan magazine, you read about a hot new craze: pet mudraptors. How cool would it be if you could hatch and train a mudraptor from birth to be your loyal ally? Your captain wouldn't dare refuse your requests for a pay raise after that. Now, it just so happens the beacon station here was destroyed by mudraptors, and they may have left an egg behind. You better volunteer to fix that station and find the egg!
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.objecti: Obtain a mudraptor egg from the beacon station and bring it into the submarine.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.c2: You found a mudraptor's egg! Now to sneak it back to the submarine unseen…
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.c3: You've obtained an egg. Better keep it safe for now.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture_beacon.objecti: A mudraptor egg has been brought to the submarine. Keep it safe from deconstructors.
A mudraptor egg has been collected. Maybe it will hatch into a beautiful and loyal pet one day?
A mudraptor egg has found its way onto the submarine.
No mudraptor eggs have been brought and kept safe on the submarine.
infotexts.traitorobjective.naturevsnurture.findmud: Find and obtain a mudraptor egg
infotexts.traitorobjective.naturevsnurture.obtainm: Bring a mudraptor egg to the submarine
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.c1: A one-armed wretch of a man has sold you a guide titled “Mudraptor Pets 101.” It is far from professional—in fact it's all written on some crusty old bandages—but he insisted he has experience in raising mudraptors as pets.\n\nAccording to the guide, the first minutes after hatching are crucial. If they get a taste of human flesh during this period, they'll forever crave more, so this should be avoided at all costs.
infotexts.EventText.naturevsnurture2.objective1: You want to hatch a mudraptor and train it as a pet.
